Author: Matthew
Sentence: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her [that had been the wife] of Urias;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: So all the generations from Abraham to David [are] fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon [are] fourteen generations; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ [are] fourteen generations.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Joseph her husband, being a just [man], and not willing to make her a publick example, was minded to put her away privily.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name JESUS: for he shall save his people from their sins.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being interpreted is, God with us.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Saying, Where is he that is born King of the Jews?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: for we have seen his star in the east, and are come to worship him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When Herod the king had heard [these things], he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they said unto him, In Bethlehem of Judaea: for thus it is written by the prophet,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And thou Bethlehem, [in] the land of Juda, art not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule my people Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, inquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he sent them to Bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently for the young child; and when ye have found [him], bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, till it came and stood over where the young child was.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when they were come into the house, they saw the young child with Mary his mother, and fell down, and worshipped him: and when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto him gifts; gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when they were departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word: for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem, and in all the coasts thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: In Rama was there a voice heard, lamentation, and weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping [for] her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Saying, Arise, and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they are dead which sought the young child’s life.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither: notwithstanding, being warned of God in a dream, he turned aside into the parts of Galilee:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets, He shall be called a Nazarene.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the same John had his raiment of camel’s hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the region round about Jordan,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said unto them, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to [our] father: for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance: but he that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost, and [with] fire:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and gather his wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto him, Suffer [it to be so] now: for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then he suffered him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus, when he was baptized, went up straightway out of the water: and, lo, the heavens were opened unto him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and lighting upon him:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in [their] hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, [by] the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they straightway left [their] nets, and followed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James [the son] of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and [from] Decapolis, and [from] Jerusalem, and [from] Judaea, and [from] beyond Jordan.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] the poor in spirit: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] the pure in heart: for they shall see God.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed [are] they which are persecuted for righteousness’ sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Blessed are ye, when [men] shall revile you, and persecute [you], and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Rejoice, and be exceeding glad: for great [is] your reward in heaven: for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye are the light of the world.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For verily I say unto you, Till heaven and earth pass, one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven: but whosoever shall do and teach [them], the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed [the righteousness] of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not kill; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar, and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way; first be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Agree with thine adversary quickly, whiles thou art in the way with him; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if thy right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast [it] from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not [that] thy whole body should be cast into hell.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if thy right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast [it] from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not [that] thy whole body should be cast into hell.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That whosoever shall put away his wife, saving for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, Swear not at all; neither by heaven; for it is God’s throne:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That ye resist not evil: but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him have [thy] cloke also.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: do not even the publicans the same?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more [than others]?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: do not even the publicans so?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore when thou doest [thine] alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites [are]: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen [do]: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Thy kingdom come.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Thy will be done in earth, as [it is] in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Give us this day our daily bread.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great [is] that darkness!

Author: Matthew
Sentence: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Are ye not much better than they?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And why take ye thought for raiment?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, [shall he] not much more [clothe] you, O ye of little faith?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: or, What shall we drink?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Sufficient unto the day [is] the evil thereof.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Judge not, that ye be not judged.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother’s eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye; and, behold, a beam [is] in thine own eye?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother’s eye.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide [is] the gate, and broad [is] the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Because strait [is] the gate, and narrow [is] the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Ye shall know them by their fruits.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Do men gather grapes of thorns, or figs of thistles?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither [can] a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in thy name?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and in thy name have cast out devils?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and in thy name done many wonderful works?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built his house upon a rock:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it was founded upon a rock.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine, and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, which built his house upon the sand:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For he taught them as [one] having authority, and not as the scribes.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, there came a leper and worshipped him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus put forth [his] hand, and touched him, saying, I will; be thou clean.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus saith unto him, I will come and heal him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this [man], Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth [it].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When Jesus heard [it], he marvelled, and said to them that followed, Verily I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And I say unto you, That many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus said unto the centurion, Go thy way; and as thou hast believed, [so] be it done unto thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when Jesus was come into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother laid, and sick of a fever.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When the even was come, they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils: and he cast out the spirits with [his] word, and healed all that were sick:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities, and bare [our] sicknesses.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus saith unto him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air [have] nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay [his] head.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But Jesus said unto him, Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, there arose a great tempest in the sea, insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves: but he was asleep.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his disciples came to [him], and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceeding fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: art thou come hither to torment us before the time?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he said unto them, Go.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when they were come out, they went into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they that kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told every thing, and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus: and when they saw him, they besought [him] that he would depart out of their coasts.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy; Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This [man] blasphemeth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said, Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For whether is easier, to say, [Thy] sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins, (then saith he to the sick of the palsy,) Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thine house.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he arose, and departed to his house.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when the multitudes saw [it], they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him, Follow me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he arose, and followed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the Pharisees saw [it], they said unto his disciples, Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when Jesus heard [that], he said unto them, They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But go ye and learn what [that] meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus said unto them, Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: but the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles: else the bottles break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottles perish: but they put new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: While he spake these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler, and worshipped him, saying, My daughter is even now dead: but come and lay thy hand upon her, and she shall live.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus arose, and followed him, and [so did] his disciples.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, a woman, which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years, came behind [him], and touched the hem of his garment:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But Jesus turned him about, and when he saw her, he said, Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the woman was made whole from that hour.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He said unto them, Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they laughed him to scorn.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed him, crying, and saying, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on us.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he was come into the house, the blind men came to him: and Jesus saith unto them, Believe ye that I am able to do this?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: They said unto him, Yea, Lord.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then touched he their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it unto you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See [that] no man know [it].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion on them, because they fainted, and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then saith he unto his disciples, The harvest truly [is] plenteous, but the labourers [are] few;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he had called unto [him] his twelve disciples, he gave them power [against] unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these; The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James [the son] of Zebedee, and John his brother;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Philip, and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James [the son] of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: These twelve Jesus sent forth, and commanded them, saying, Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into [any] city of the Samaritans enter ye not:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Nor scrip for [your] journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, inquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when ye come into an house, salute it.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it: but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child: and the children shall rise up against [their] parents, and cause them to be put to death.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another: for verily I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel, till the Son of man be come.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The disciple is not above [his] master, nor the servant above his lord.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more [shall they call] them of his household?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Fear them not therefore: for there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: What I tell you in darkness, [that] speak ye in light: and what ye hear in the ear, [that] preach ye upon the housetops.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her mother in law.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And a man’s foes [shall be] they of his own household.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold [water] only in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Now when John had heard in the prison the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto them, Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The blind receive their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have the gospel preached to them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And blessed is [he], whosoever shall not be offended in me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A reed shaken with the wind?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But what went ye out for to see?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A man clothed in soft raiment?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: behold, they that wear soft [clothing] are in kings’ houses.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But what went ye out for to see?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A prophet?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For this is [he], of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, Among them that are born of women there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist: notwithstanding he that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if ye will receive [it], this is Elias, which was for to come.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But whereunto shall I liken this generation?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: It is like unto children sitting in the markets, and calling unto their fellows,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The Son of man came eating and drinking, and they say, Behold a man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But wisdom is justified of her children.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then began he to upbraid the cities wherein most of his mighty works were done, because they repented not:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Woe unto thee, Chorazin!

Author: Matthew
Sentence: woe unto thee, Bethsaida!

Author: Matthew
Sentence: for if the mighty works, which were done in you, had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell: for if the mighty works, which have been done in thee, had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: All things are delivered unto me of my Father: and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and [he] to whomsoever the Son will reveal [him].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Come unto me, all [ye] that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For my yoke [is] easy, and my burden is light.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when the Pharisees saw [it], they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: How he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the priests?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That in this place is [one] greater than the temple.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But if ye had known what [this] meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, there was a man which had [his] hand withered.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: that they might accuse him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift [it] out?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: How much then is a man better than a sheep?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he stretched [it] forth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when Jesus knew [it], he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And charged them that they should not make him known:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, till he send forth judgment unto victory.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when the Pharisees heard [it], they said, This [fellow] doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast [them] out?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: therefore they shall be your judges.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Or else how can one enter into a strong man’s house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and then he will spoil his house.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Wherefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy [against] the [Holy] Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the [world] to come.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by [his] fruit.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale’s belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas [is] here.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon [is] here.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth [it] empty, swept, and garnished.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last [state] of that man is worse than the first.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: While he yet talked to the people, behold, [his] mother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and who are my brethren?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying, Behold, a sower went forth to sow;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he sowed, some [seeds] fell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He answered and said unto them, Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, and [their] ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed; lest at any time they should see with [their] eyes, and hear with [their] ears, and should understand with [their] heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But blessed [are] your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous [men] have desired to see [those things] which ye see, and have not seen [them]; and to hear [those things] which ye hear, and have not heard [them].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth [it] not, then cometh the wicked [one], and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: This is he which received seed by the way side.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth [it]; which also beareth fruit, and bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: from whence then hath it tares?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He said unto them, An enemy hath done this.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Another parable spake he unto them; The kingdom of heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked [one];

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, Have ye understood all these things?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then said he unto them, Therefore every scribe [which is] instructed unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man [that is] an householder, which bringeth forth out of his treasure [things] new and old.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And it came to pass, [that] when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he was come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, Whence hath this [man] this wisdom, and [these] mighty works?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Is not this the carpenter’s son?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: is not his mother called Mary?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: and his brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his sisters, are they not all with us?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Whence then hath this [man] all these things?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they were offended in him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, save in his own country, and in his own house.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And said unto his servants, This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead; and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put [him] in prison for Herodias’ sake, his brother Philip’s wife.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when Herod’s birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist’s head in a charger.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath’s sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded [it] to be given [her].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she brought [it] to her mother.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: When Jesus heard [of it], he departed thence by ship into a desert place apart: and when the people had heard [thereof], they followed him on foot out of the cities.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when it was evening, his disciples came to him, saying, This is a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves victuals.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But Jesus said unto them, They need not depart; give ye them to eat.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He said, Bring them hither to me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake, and gave the loaves to [his] disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And straightway Jesus constrained his disciples to get into a ship, and to go before him unto the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into a mountain apart to pray: and when the evening was come, he was there alone.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cried out for fear.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he said, Come.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But when he saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And immediately Jesus stretched forth [his] hand, and caught him, and said unto him, O thou of little faith, wherefore didst thou doubt?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when the men of that place had knowledge of him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto him all that were diseased;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to [his] father or [his] mother, [It is] a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And honour not his father or his mother, [he shall be free].

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: [Ye] hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,

Author: Matthew
Sentence: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with [their] lips; but their heart is far from me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But in vain they do worship me, teaching [for] doctrines the commandments of men.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: These are [the things] which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, [thou] Son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered her not a word.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast [it] to dogs.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great [is] thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them [those that were] lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus’ feet; and he healed them:

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Jesus called his disciples [unto him], and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake [them], and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken [meat] that was left seven baskets full.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: He answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, [It will be] fair weather: for the sky is red.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And in the morning, [It will be] foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: O [ye] hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not [discern] the signs of the times?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And he left them, and departed.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, [It is] because we have taken no bread.

Author: Matthew
Sentence: [Which] when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

Author: Matthew
Sentence: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

Author: Matthew
