Sentence: And the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time [is] far passed:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Send them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.

Author: Mark
Sentence: He answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?

Author: Mark
Sentence: He saith unto them, How many loaves have ye?

Author: Mark
Sentence: go and see.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave [them] to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they did all eat, and were filled.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:

Author: Mark
Sentence: For they all saw him, and were troubled.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For they considered not [the miracle] of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,

Author: Mark
Sentence: And ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash [their] hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And [when they come] from the market, except they wash, they eat not.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, [as] the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

Author: Mark
Sentence: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with [their] lips, but their heart is far from me.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching [for] doctrines the commandments of men.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, [as] the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:

Author: Mark
Sentence: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, [It is] Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; [he shall be free].

Author: Mark
Sentence: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

Author: Mark
Sentence: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he had called all the people [unto him], he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one [of you], and understand:

Author: Mark
Sentence: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.

Author: Mark
Sentence: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also?

Author: Mark
Sentence: Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, [it] cannot defile him;

Author: Mark
Sentence: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,

Author: Mark
Sentence: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

Author: Mark
Sentence: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know [it]: but he could not be hid.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For a [certain] woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:

Author: Mark
Sentence: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast [it] unto the dogs.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children’s crumbs.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

Author: Mark
Sentence: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published [it];

Author: Mark
Sentence: And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

Author: Mark
Sentence: In those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples [unto him], and saith unto them,

Author: Mark
Sentence: I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now been with me three days, and have nothing to eat:

Author: Mark
Sentence: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for divers of them came from far.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these [men] with bread here in the wilderness?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they said, Seven.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before [them]; and they did set [them] before the people.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before [them].

Author: Mark
Sentence: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken [meat] that was left seven baskets.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign?

Author: Mark
Sentence: verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Now [the disciples] had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, and [of] the leaven of Herod.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, [It is] because we have no bread.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when Jesus knew [it], he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread?

Author: Mark
Sentence: perceive ye not yet, neither understand?

Author: Mark
Sentence: have ye your heart yet hardened?

Author: Mark
Sentence: Having eyes, see ye not?

Author: Mark
Sentence: and having ears, hear ye not?

Author: Mark
Sentence: and do ye not remember?

Author: Mark
Sentence: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?

Author: Mark
Sentence: They say unto him, Twelve.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they said, Seven.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto them, How is it that ye do not understand?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.

Author: Mark
Sentence: After that he put [his] hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither go into the town, nor tell [it] to any in the town.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom do men say that I am?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they answered, John the Baptist: but some [say], Elias; and others, One of the prophets.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and [of] the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he spake that saying openly.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get thee behind me, Satan: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but the things that be of men.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he had called the people [unto him] with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s, the same shall save it.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?

Author: Mark
Sentence: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

Author: Mark
Sentence: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And after six days Jesus taketh [with him] Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he came to [his] disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to [him] saluted him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;

Author: Mark
Sentence: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.

Author: Mark
Sentence: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you?

Author: Mark
Sentence: how long shall I suffer you?

Author: Mark
Sentence: bring him unto me.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said, Of a child.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things [are] possible to him that believeth.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

Author: Mark
Sentence: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, [Thou] dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And [the spirit] cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know [it].

Sentence: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?

Sentence: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who [should be] the greatest.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, [the same] shall be last of all, and servant of all.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,

Sentence: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.

Sentence: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.

Sentence: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.

Sentence: For he that is not against us is on our part.

Sentence: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And whosoever shall offend one of [these] little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Salt [is] good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it?

Author: Mark
Sentence: Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away [his] wife?

Author: Mark
Sentence: tempting him.

Author: Mark

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put [her] away.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

Author: Mark
Sentence: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same [matter].

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and [his] disciples rebuked those that brought [them].

Sentence: But when Jesus saw [it], he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

Sentence: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.

Sentence: And he took them up in his arms, put [his] hands upon them, and blessed them.

Sentence: [there is] none good but one, [that is], God.

Sentence: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.

Sentence: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.

Sentence: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.

Sentence: And the disciples were astonished at his words.

Sentence: But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!

Sentence: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?

Sentence: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men [it is] impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel’s,

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid.

Sentence: And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,

Sentence: [Saying], Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:

Sentence: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.

Sentence: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.

Sentence: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but [it shall be given to them] for whom it is prepared.

Sentence: And when the ten heard [it], they began to be much displeased with James and John.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.

Sentence: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee?

Sentence: And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

Sentence: And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring [him].

Sentence: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this?

Sentence: say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.

Sentence: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed [them] in the way.

Sentence: Blessed [be] the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.

Sentence: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:

Sentence: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not [yet].

Sentence: And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.

Sentence: And his disciples heard [it].

Sentence: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer?

Sentence: but ye have made it a den of thieves.

Sentence: And the scribes and chief priests heard [it], and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.

Sentence: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

Sentence: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

Sentence: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive [them], and ye shall have [them].

Sentence: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,

Sentence: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things?

Sentence: and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

Sentence: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

Sentence: The baptism of John, was [it] from heaven, or of men?

Sentence: answer me.

Sentence: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all [men] counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.

Sentence: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

Sentence: And they caught [him], and beat him, and sent [him] away empty.

Sentence: And again he sent unto them another servant; and at him they cast stones, and wounded [him] in the head, and sent [him] away shamefully handled.

Sentence: And again he sent another; and him they killed, and many others; beating some, and killing some.

Sentence: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.

Sentence: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.

Sentence: And they took him, and killed [him], and cast [him] out of the vineyard.

Sentence: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do?

Sentence: he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

Sentence: And have ye not read this scripture; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner:

Sentence: This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?

Sentence: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in [his] words.

Sentence: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?

Sentence: Shall we give, or shall we not give?

Sentence: But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me?

Sentence: bring me a penny, that I may see [it].

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they brought [it].

Sentence: And he saith unto them, Whose [is] this image and superscription?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they said unto him, Caesar’s.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto them, Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And they marvelled at him.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Then come unto him the Sadducees, which say there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,

Author: Mark
Sentence: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man’s brother die, and leave [his] wife [behind him], and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

Sentence: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them?

Sentence: for the seven had her to wife.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto them, Do ye not therefore err, because ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of God?

Author: Mark
Sentence: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as the angels which are in heaven.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And as touching the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spake unto him, saying, I [am] the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

Author: Mark
Sentence: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, and perceiving that he had answered them well, asked him, Which is the first commandment of all?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments [is], Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:

Author: Mark
Sentence: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this [is] the first commandment.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the second [is] like, [namely] this, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

Author: Mark
Sentence: There is none other commandment greater than these.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the scribe said unto him, Well, Master, thou hast said the truth: for there is one God; and there is none other but he:

Author: Mark
Sentence: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love [his] neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.

Sentence: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God.

Sentence: And no man after that durst ask him [any question].

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?

Author: Mark
Sentence: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost, The LORD said to my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

Author: Mark
Sentence: David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he [then] his son?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the common people heard him gladly.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he said unto them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, which love to go in long clothing, and [love] salutations in the marketplaces,

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And he called [unto him] his disciples, and saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That this poor widow hath cast more in, than all they which have cast into the treasury:

Author: Mark
Sentence: For all [they] did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, [even] all her living.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Master, see what manner of stones and what buildings [are here]!

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings?

Author: Mark
Sentence: there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,

Author: Mark
Sentence: Tell us, when shall these things be?

Author: Mark
Sentence: and what [shall be] the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

Author: Mark
Sentence: And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any [man] deceive you:

Author: Mark
Sentence: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am [Christ]; and shall deceive many.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for [such things] must needs be; but the end [shall] not [be] yet.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these [are] the beginnings of sorrows.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But when they shall lead [you], and deliver you up, take no thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against [their] parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name’s sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not, (let him that readeth understand,) then let them that be in Judaea flee to the mountains:

Author: Mark
Sentence: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter [therein], to take any thing out of his house:

Author: Mark
Sentence: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

Author: Mark
Sentence: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.

Author: Mark
Sentence: For [in] those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect’s sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, here [is] Christ; or, lo, [he is] there; believe [him] not:

Author: Mark
Sentence: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if [it were] possible, even the elect.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,

Author: Mark
Sentence: And the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And then shall he send his angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near:

Author: Mark
Sentence: So ye in like manner, when ye shall see these things come to pass, know that it is nigh, [even] at the doors.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall not pass, till all these things be done.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But of that day and [that] hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels which are in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

Author: Mark
Sentence: [For the Son of man is] as a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants, and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.

Author: Mark
Sentence: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:

Author: Mark
Sentence: Lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.

Author: Mark
Sentence: After two days was [the feast of] the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put [him] to death.

Author: Mark
Sentence: But they said, Not on the feast [day], lest there be an uproar of the people.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of spikenard very precious; and she brake the box, and poured [it] on his head.

Author: Mark
Sentence: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;

Author: Luke
Sentence: It seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,

Author: Luke
Sentence: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abia: and his wife [was] of the daughters of Aaron, and her name [was] Elisabeth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were [now] well stricken in years.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his course,

Author: Luke
Sentence: According to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Zacharias saw [him], he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this?

Author: Luke
Sentence: for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew thee these glad tidings.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on [me], to take away my reproach among men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

Author: Luke
Sentence: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin’s name [was] Mary.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel came in unto her, and said, Hail, [thou that art] highly favoured, the Lord [is] with thee: blessed [art] thou among women.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when she saw [him], she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For with God nothing shall be impossible.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel departed from her.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed [art] thou among women, and blessed [is] the fruit of thy womb.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And blessed [is] she that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden: for, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy [is] his name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his mercy [is] on them that fear him from generation to generation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He hath shewed strength with his arm; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He hath put down the mighty from [their] seats, and exalted them of low degree.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He hath filled the hungry with good things; and the rich he hath sent empty away.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He hath holpen his servant Israel, in remembrance of [his] mercy;

Author: Luke
Sentence: As he spake to our fathers, to Abraham, and to his seed for ever.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now Elisabeth’s full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his mother answered and said, Not [so]; but he shall be called John.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they marvelled all.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue [loosed], and he spake, and praised God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all they that heard [them] laid [them] up in their hearts, saying, What manner of child shall this be!

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the hand of the Lord was with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Blessed [be] the Lord God of Israel; for he hath visited and redeemed his people,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David;

Author: Luke
Sentence: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:

Author: Luke
Sentence: That we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;

Author: Luke
Sentence: To perform the mercy [promised] to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant;

Author: Luke
Sentence: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham,

Author: Luke
Sentence: That he would grant unto us, that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear,

Author: Luke
Sentence: In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest: for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;

Author: Luke
Sentence: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,

Author: Luke
Sentence: To give light to them that sit in darkness and [in] the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: ([And] this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)

Author: Luke
Sentence: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And this [shall be] a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had seen [it], they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all they that heard [it] wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Mary kept all these things, and pondered [them] in her heart.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present [him] to the Lord;

Author: Luke
Sentence: (As it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)

Author: Luke
Sentence: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name [was] Simeon; and the same man [was] just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;

Author: Luke
Sentence: A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this [child] is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;

Author: Luke
Sentence: (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she [was] a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served [God] with fastings and prayers night and day.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not [of it].

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day’s journey; and they sought him among [their] kinsfolk and acquaintance.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us?

Author: Luke
Sentence: behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: wist ye not that I must be about my Father’s business?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;

Author: Luke
Sentence: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways [shall be] made smooth;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to [our] father: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?

Author: Luke
Sentence: He answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse [any] falsely; and be content with your wages.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;

Author: Luke
Sentence: John answered, saying unto [them] all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which was [the son] of Heli,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi, which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Janna, which was [the son] of Joseph,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Amos, which was [the son] of Naum, which was [the son] of Esli, which was [the son] of Nagge,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Maath, which was [the son] of Mattathias, which was [the son] of Semei, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Juda,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Joanna, which was [the son] of Rhesa, which was [the son] of Zorobabel, which was [the son] of Salathiel, which was [the son] of Neri,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Melchi, which was [the son] of Addi, which was [the son] of Cosam, which was [the son] of Elmodam, which was [the son] of Er,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Jose, which was [the son] of Eliezer, which was [the son] of Jorim, which was [the son] of Matthat, which was [the son] of Levi,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Simeon, which was [the son] of Juda, which was [the son] of Joseph, which was [the son] of Jonan, which was [the son] of Eliakim,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Melea, which was [the son] of Menan, which was [the son] of Mattatha, which was [the son] of Nathan, which was [the son] of David,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Jesse, which was [the son] of Obed, which was [the son] of Booz, which was [the son] of Salmon, which was [the son] of Naasson,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Aminadab, which was [the son] of Aram, which was [the son] of Esrom, which was [the son] of Phares, which was [the son] of Juda,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Jacob, which was [the son] of Isaac, which was [the son] of Abraham, which was [the son] of Thara, which was [the son] of Nachor,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Saruch, which was [the son] of Ragau, which was [the son] of Phalec, which was [the son] of Heber, which was [the son] of Sala,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Cainan, which was [the son] of Arphaxad, which was [the son] of Sem, which was [the son] of Noe, which was [the son] of Lamech,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Mathusala, which was [the son] of Enoch, which was [the son] of Jared, which was [the son] of Maleleel, which was [the son] of Cainan,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was [the son] of Enos, which was [the son] of Seth, which was [the son] of Adam, which was [the son] of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Being forty days tempted of the devil.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answered him, saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.

Author: Luke
Sentence: If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in [their] hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,

Author: Luke
Sentence: The Spirit of the Lord [is] upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,

Author: Luke
Sentence: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he closed the book, and he gave [it] again to the minister, and sat down.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, Is not this Joseph’s son?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;

Author: Luke
Sentence: But unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta, [a city] of Sidon, unto a woman [that was] a widow.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, saving Naaman the Syrian.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he passing through the midst of them went his way,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Let [us] alone; what have we to do with thee, [thou] Jesus of Nazareth?

Author: Luke
Sentence: art thou come to destroy us?

Author: Luke
Sentence: I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a word [is] this!

Author: Luke
Sentence: for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he rebuking [them] suffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing [their] nets.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon’s, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they beckoned unto [their] partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When Simon Peter saw [it], he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And so [was] also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on [his] face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he put forth [his] hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was [present] to heal them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought [means] to bring him in, and to lay [him] before him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they could not find by what [way] they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with [his] couch into the midst before Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.

Author: Luke
Sentence: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise [the disciples] of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was [taken] out of the new agreeth not with the old.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: No man also having drunk old [wine] straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he went through the corn fields; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn, and did eat, rubbing [them] in [their] hands.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answering them said, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was an hungred, and they which were with him;

Author: Luke
Sentence: How he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass also on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught: and there was a man whose right hand was withered.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him, whether he would heal on the sabbath day; that they might find an accusation against him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the withered hand, Rise up, and stand forth in the midst.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he arose and stood forth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good, or to do evil?

Author: Luke
Sentence: to save life, or to destroy [it]?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And looking round about upon them all, he said unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he did so: and his hand was restored whole as the other.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were filled with madness; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when it was day, he called [unto him] his disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Simon, (whom he also named Peter,) and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Matthew and Thomas, James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Judas [the brother] of James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;

Author: Luke
