Sentence: Two [men] shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they answered and said unto him, Where, Lord?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Wheresoever the body [is], thither will the eagles be gathered together.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he spake a parable unto them [to this end], that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he would not for a while: but afterward he said within himself, Though I fear not God, nor regard man;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Yet because this widow troubleth me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she weary me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge saith.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And shall not God avenge his own elect, which cry day and night unto him, though he bear long with them?

Author: Luke
Sentence: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a publican.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself, God, I thank thee, that I am not as other men [are], extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even as this publican.

Author: Luke
Sentence: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the publican, standing afar off, would not lift up so much as [his] eyes unto heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me a sinner.

Author: Luke
Sentence: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified [rather] than the other: for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch them: but when [his] disciples saw [it], they rebuked them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Jesus called them [unto him], and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good?

Author: Luke
Sentence: none [is] good, save one, [that is], God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful, he said, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

Author: Luke
Sentence: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they that heard [it] said, Who then can be saved?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then he took [unto him] the twelve, and said unto them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles, and shall be mocked, and spitefully entreated, and spitted on:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they shall scourge [him], and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he cried, saying, Jesus, [thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, [Thou] Son of David, have mercy on me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto him, Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God: and all the people, when they saw [it], gave praise unto God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And [Jesus] entered and passed through Jericho.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, [there was] a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he sought to see Jesus who he was; and could not for the press, because he was little of stature.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass that [way].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Jesus came to the place, he looked up, and saw him, and said unto him, Zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must abide at thy house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they saw [it], they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Zacchaeus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore [him] fourfold.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto him, This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they heard these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem, and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this [man] to reign over us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto him, Well, thou good servant: because thou hast been faithful in a very little, have thou authority over ten cities.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And another came, saying, Lord, behold, [here is] thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he saith unto him, Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee, [thou] wicked servant.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up that I laid not down, and reaping that I did not sow:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and give [it] to him that hath ten pounds.

Author: Luke
Sentence: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I say unto you, That unto every one which hath shall be given; and from him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over them, bring hither, and slay [them] before me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called [the mount] of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Go ye into the village over against [you]; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet never man sat: loose him, and bring [him hither].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose [him]?

Author: Luke
Sentence: thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Blessed [be] the King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he answered and said unto them, I tell you that, if these should hold their peace, the stones would immediately cry out.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things [which belong] unto thy peace!

Author: Luke
Sentence: but now they are hid from thine eyes.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For the days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every side,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he taught daily in the temple.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, [that] on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon [him] with the elders,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things?

Author: Luke
Sentence: or who is he that gave thee this authority?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he answered and said unto them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:

Author: Luke
Sentence: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then believed ye him not?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But and if we say, Of men; all the people will stone us: for they be persuaded that John was a prophet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they answered, that they could not tell whence [it was].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then began he to speak to the people this parable; A certain man planted a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a far country for a long time.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat him, and sent [him] away empty.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreated [him] shamefully, and sent [him] away empty.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and cast [him] out.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do?

Author: Luke
Sentence: I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence [him] when they see him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killed [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

Author: Luke
Sentence: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they heard [it], they said, God forbid.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he beheld them, and said, What is this then that is written, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they watched [him], and sent forth spies, which should feign themselves just men, that they might take hold of his words, that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they asked him, saying, Master, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person [of any], but teachest the way of God truly:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar, or no?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them, Why tempt ye me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Shew me a penny.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whose image and superscription hath it?

Author: Luke
Sentence: They answered and said, Caesar’s.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar’s, and unto God the things which be God’s.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came to [him] certain of the Sadducees, which deny that there is any resurrection; and they asked him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man’s brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

Author: Luke
Sentence: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and they left no children, and died.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Last of all the woman died also.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she?

Author: Luke
Sentence: for seven had her to wife.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answering said unto them, The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now that the dead are raised, even Moses shewed at the bush, when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he is not a God of the dead, but of the living: for all live unto him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after that they durst not ask him any [question at all].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David’s son?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

Author: Luke
Sentence: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Beware of the scribes, which desire to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the markets, and the highest seats in the synagogues, and the chief rooms at feasts;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which devour widows’ houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive greater damnation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,

Author: Luke
Sentence: [As for] these things which ye behold, the days will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they asked him, saying, Master, but when shall these things be?

Author: Luke
Sentence: and what sign [will there be] when these things shall come to pass?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Take heed that ye be not deceived: for many shall come in my name, saying, I am [Christ]; and the time draweth near: go ye not therefore after them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions, be not terrified: for these things must first come to pass; but the end [is] not by and by.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said he unto them, Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places, and famines, and pestilences; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But before all these, they shall lay their hands on you, and persecute [you], delivering [you] up to the synagogues, and into prisons, being brought before kings and rulers for my name’s sake.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Settle [it] therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents, and brethren, and kinsfolks, and friends; and [some] of you shall they cause to be put to death.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And ye shall be hated of all [men] for my name’s sake.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.

Author: Luke
Sentence: In your patience possess ye your souls.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck, in those days!

Author: Luke
Sentence: for there shall be great distress in the land, and wrath upon this people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and shall be led away captive into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there shall be signs in the sun, and in the moon, and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the sea and the waves roaring;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Men’s hearts failing them for fear, and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth: for the powers of heaven shall be shaken.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when these things begin to come to pass, then look up, and lift up your heads; for your redemption draweth nigh.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he spake to them a parable; Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So likewise ye, when ye see these things come to pass, know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and [so] that day come upon you unawares.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called [the mount] of Olives.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide [it] among yourselves:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake [it], and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, This cup [is] the new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me [is] with me on the table.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they began to inquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But ye [shall] not [be] so: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For whether [is] greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth?

Author: Luke
Sentence: [is] not he that sitteth at meat?

Author: Luke
Sentence: but I am among you as he that serveth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;

Author: Luke
Sentence: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired [to have] you, that he may sift [you] as wheat:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, Nothing.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take [it], and likewise [his] scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, Lord, behold, here [are] two swords.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, It is enough.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone’s cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said unto them, Why sleep ye?

Author: Luke
Sentence: rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he touched his ear, and healed him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?

Author: Luke
Sentence: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then took they him, and led [him], and brought him into the high priest’s house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter followed afar off.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter said, Man, I am not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this [fellow] also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smote [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Art thou the Christ?

Author: Luke
Sentence: tell us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And if I also ask [you], ye will not answer me, nor let [me] go.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, What need we any further witness?

Author: Luke
Sentence: for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this [fellow] perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he answered him and said, Thou sayest [it].

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and [to] the people, I find no fault in this man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long [season], because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked [him], and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined [him] before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:

Author: Luke
Sentence: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: I will therefore chastise him, and release [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this [man], and release unto us Barabbas:

Author: Luke
Sentence: (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they cried, saying, Crucify [him], crucify him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done?

Author: Luke
Sentence: I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let [him] go.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear [it] after Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed [are] the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the people stood beholding.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the rulers also with them derided [him], saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, [there was] a man named Joseph, a counseller; [and he was] a good man, and a just:

Author: Luke
Sentence: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) [he was] of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This [man] went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now upon the first [day] of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain [others] with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they were afraid, and bowed down [their] faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?

Author: Luke
Sentence: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they remembered his words,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.

Author: Luke
Sentence: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary [the mother] of James, and other [women that were] with them, which told these things unto the apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem [about] threescore furlongs.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that, while they communed [together] and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, What manner of communications [are] these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, What things?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found [it] even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went in to tarry with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessed [it], and brake, and gave to them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they told what things [were done] in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace [be] unto you.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled?

Author: Luke
Sentence: and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them [his] hands and [his] feet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he took [it], and did eat before them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, These [are] the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and [in] the prophets, and [in] the psalms, concerning me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And ye are witnesses of these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen:

Author: Luke
Sentence: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, being assembled together with [them], commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which, [saith he], ye have heard of me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For John truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven?

Author: Luke
Sentence: this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day’s journey.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James [the son] of Alphaeus, and Simon Zelotes, and Judas [the brother] of James.

Author: Luke
Sentence: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)

Author: Luke
Sentence: Men [and] brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and his bishoprick let another take.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all [men], shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,

Author: Luke
Sentence: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all [ye] that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is [but] the third hour of the day.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

Author: Luke
Sentence: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before that great and notable day of the Lord come:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it shall come to pass, [that] whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For David speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Men [and] brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne;

Author: Luke
Sentence: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For David is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The LORD said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when they heard [this], they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men [and] brethren, what shall we do?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, [even] as many as the Lord our God shall call.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: and the same day there were added [unto them] about three thousand souls.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all [men], as every man had need.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Praising God, and having favour with all the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, [being] the ninth [hour].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted [him] up: and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Peter saw [it], he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this?

Author: Luke
Sentence: or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?

Author: Luke
Sentence: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let [him] go.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did [it], as [did] also your rulers.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it shall come to pass, [that] every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they laid hands on them, and put [them] in hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed; and the number of the men was about five thousand.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

Author: Luke
Sentence: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, [even] by him doth this man stand here before you whole.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, What shall we do to these men?

Author: Luke
Sentence: for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them [is] manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem; and we cannot deny [it].

Author: Luke
Sentence: But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people: for all [men] glorified God for that which was done.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thou [art] God, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?

Author: Luke
Sentence: The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord, and against his Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,

Author: Luke
Sentence: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

Author: Luke
Sentence: By stretching forth thine hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul: neither said any [of them] that ought of the things which he possessed was his own; but they had all things common.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus: and great grace was upon them all.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Neither was there any among them that lacked: for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And laid [them] down at the apostles’ feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, [and] of the country of Cyprus,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Having land, sold [it], and brought the money, and laid [it] at the apostles’ feet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And kept back [part] of the price, his wife also being privy [to it], and brought a certain part, and laid [it] at the apostles’ feet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back [part] of the price of the land?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own?

Author: Luke
Sentence: and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power?

Author: Luke
Sentence: why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart?

Author: Luke
Sentence: thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried [him] out, and buried [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she said, Yea, for so much.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?

Author: Luke
Sentence: behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband [are] at the door, and shall carry thee out.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying [her] forth, buried [her] by her husband.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid [them] on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: There came also a multitude [out] of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they heard [that], they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had brought them, they set [them] before the council: and the high priest asked them,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name?

Author: Luke
Sentence: and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter and the [other] apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Him hath God exalted with his right hand [to be] a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And we are his witnesses of these things; and [so is] also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they heard [that], they were cut [to the heart], and took counsel to slay them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.

Author: Luke
Sentence: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, [even] as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten [them], they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples [unto them], and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid [their] hands on them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called [the synagogue] of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and [against] God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon [him], and caught him, and brought [him] to the council,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran: and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not [so much as] to set his foot on: yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when [as yet] he had no child.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat [them] evil four hundred years.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God: and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision: and so [Abraham] begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac [begat] Jacob; and Jacob [begat] the twelve patriarchs.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction: and our fathers found no sustenance.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And at the second [time] Joseph was made known to his brethren; and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to [him], and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor [the father] of Sychem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

Author: Luke
