Sentence: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.

Author: Luke
Sentence: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And seeing one [of them] suffer wrong, he defended [him], and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them: but they understood not.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove, and would have set them at one again, saying, Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one to another?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When Moses saw [it], he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to behold [it], the voice of the Lord came unto him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: [Saying], I [am] the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Moses trembled, and durst not behold.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said the Lord to him, Put off thy shoes from thy feet: for the place where thou standest is holy ground.

Author: Luke
Sentence: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This Moses whom they refused, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge?

Author: Luke
Sentence: the same did God send [to be] a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He brought them out, after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This is that Moses, which said unto the children of Israel, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This is he, that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina, and [with] our fathers: who received the lively oracles to give unto us:

Author: Luke
Sentence: To whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust [him] from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying unto Aaron, Make us gods to go before us: for [as for] this Moses, which brought us out of the land of Egypt, we wot not what is become of him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then God turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven; as it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices [by the space of] forty years in the wilderness?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch, and the star of your god Remphan, figures which ye made to worship them: and I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as he had appointed, speaking unto Moses, that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles, whom God drave out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Solomon built him an house.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands; as saith the prophet,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Heaven [is] my throne, and earth [is] my footstool: what house will ye build me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: saith the Lord: or what [is] the place of my rest?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Hath not my hand made all these things?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers [did], so [do] ye.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted?

Author: Luke
Sentence: and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept [it].

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him with [their] teeth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up stedfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And cast [him] out of the city, and stoned [him]: and the witnesses laid down their clothes at a young man’s feet, whose name was Saul.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they stoned Stephen, calling upon [God], and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Saul was consenting unto his death.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And devout men carried Stephen [to his burial], and made great lamentation over him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed [them] to prison.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed [with them]: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was great joy in that city.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:

Author: Luke
Sentence: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:

Author: Luke
Sentence: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then laid they [their] hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and [in] the bond of iniquity.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Philip ran thither to [him], and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:

Author: Luke
Sentence: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation?

Author: Luke
Sentence: for his life is taken from the earth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this?

Author: Luke
Sentence: of himself, or of some other man?

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as they went on [their] way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, [here is] water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Who art thou, Lord?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest: [it is] hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Saul arose from the earth; and when his eyes were opened, he saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought [him] into Damascus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and to him said the Lord in a vision, Ananias.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Behold, I [am here], Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the Lord [said] unto him, Arise, and go into the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for [one] called Saul, of Tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and putting [his] hand on him, that he might receive his sight.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, and kings, and the children of Israel:

Author: Luke
Sentence: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name’s sake.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Ananias went his way, and entered into the house; and putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, [even] Jesus, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, and be filled with the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: and he received sight forthwith, and arose, and was baptized.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But all that heard [him] were amazed, and said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Saul increased the more in strength, and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But their laying await was known of Saul.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the disciples took him by night, and let [him] down by the wall in a basket.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem, he assayed to join himself to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believed not that he was a disciple.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Barnabas took him, and brought [him] to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: [Which] when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria, and were edified; and walking in the fear of the Lord, and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout all [quarters], he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there he found a certain man named AEneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Peter said unto him, AEneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he arose immediately.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass in those days, that she was sick, and died: whom when they had washed, they laid [her] in an upper chamber.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring [him] that he would not delay to come to them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter arose and went with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widows stood by him weeping, and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter put them all forth, and kneeled down, and prayed; and turning [him] to the body said, Tabitha, arise.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And she opened her eyes: and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he gave her [his] hand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

Author: Luke
Sentence: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian [band],

Author: Luke
Sentence: [A] devout [man], and one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, and prayed to God alway.

Author: Luke
Sentence: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him, and saying unto him, Cornelius.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now send men to Joppa, and call for [one] Simon, whose surname is Peter:

Author: Luke
Sentence: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had declared all [these] things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.

Author: Luke
Sentence: On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he became very hungry, and would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And saw heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there came a voice to him, Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the voice [spake] unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.

Author: Luke
Sentence: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon’s house, and stood before the gate,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

Author: Luke
Sentence: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; and said, Behold, I am he whom ye seek: what [is] the cause wherefore ye are come?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, and one that feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, and to hear words of thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then called he them in, and lodged [them].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Therefore came I [unto you] without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and, behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Send therefore to Joppa, and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter; he is lodged in the house of [one] Simon a tanner by the sea side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Peter opened [his] mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The word which [God] sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ: (he is Lord of all:)

Author: Luke
Sentence: That word, [I say], ye know, which was published throughout all Judaea, and began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

Author: Luke
Sentence: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they slew and hanged on a tree:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, [even] to us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God [to be] the Judge of quick and dead.

Author: Luke
Sentence: To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.

Author: Luke
Sentence: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then answered Peter,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then prayed they him to tarry certain days.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter rehearsed [the matter] from the beginning, and expounded [it] by order unto them, saying,

Author: Luke
Sentence: I was in the city of Joppa praying: and in a trance I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came even to me:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And I heard a voice saying unto me, Arise, Peter; slay and eat.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the voice answered me again from heaven, What God hath cleansed, [that] call not thou common.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house, which stood and said unto him, Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then remembered I the word of the Lord, how that he said, John indeed baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as [he did] unto us, who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ; what was I, that I could withstand God?

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice, and Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, which, when they were come to Antioch, spake unto the Grecians, preaching the Lord Jesus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem: and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who, when he came, and had seen the grace of God, was glad, and exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith: and much people was added unto the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass, that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught much people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there stood up one of them named Agabus, and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth [his] hands to vex certain of the church.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also.

Author: Luke
Sentence: (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had apprehended him, he put [him] in prison, and delivered [him] to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And, behold, the angel of the Lord came upon [him], and a light shined in the prison: and he smote Peter on the side, and raised him up, saying, Arise up quickly.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And his chains fell off from [his] hands.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the angel said unto him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And so he did.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he saith unto him, Cast thy garment about thee, and follow me.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went out, and followed him; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When they were past the first and the second ward, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which opened to them of his own accord: and they went out, and passed on through one street; and forthwith the angel departed from him.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Peter was come to himself, he said, Now I know of a surety, that the Lord hath sent his angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and [from] all the expectation of the people of the Jews.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had considered [the thing], he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark; where many were gathered together praying.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in, and told how Peter stood before the gate.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they said unto her, Thou art mad.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But she constantly affirmed that it was even so.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then said they, It is his angel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had opened [the door], and saw him, they were astonished.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he, beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he said, Go shew these things unto James, and to the brethren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he departed, and went into another place.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when Herod had sought for him, and found him not, he examined the keepers, and commanded that [they] should be put to death.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea, and [there] abode.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s [country].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the people gave a shout, [saying, It is] the voice of a god, and not of a man.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled [their] ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers; as Barnabas, and Simeon that was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

Author: Luke
Sentence: As they ministered to the Lord, and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid [their] hands on them, they sent [them] away.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews: and they had also John to [their] minister.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name [was] Barjesus:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man; who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the word of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Saul, (who also [is called] Paul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And said, O full of all subtilty and all mischief, [thou] child of the devil, [thou] enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

Author: Luke
Sentence: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord [is] upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia: and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and sat down.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, [Ye] men [and] brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with [his] hand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.

Author: Luke
Sentence: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an high arm brought he them out of it.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after that he gave [unto them] judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And afterward they desired a king: and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, by the space of forty years.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the [son] of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Of this man’s seed hath God according to [his] promise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:

Author: Luke
Sentence: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as John fulfilled his course, he said, Whom think ye that I am?

Author: Luke
Sentence: I am not [he].

Author: Luke
Sentence: But, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of [his] feet I am not worthy to loose.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Men [and] brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For they that dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they knew him not, nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day, they have fulfilled [them] in condemning [him].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And though they found no cause of death [in him], yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him, they took [him] down from the tree, and laid [him] in a sepulchre.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But God raised him from the dead:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses unto the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

Author: Luke
Sentence: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that he hath raised up Jesus again; as it is also written in the second psalm, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead, [now] no more to return to corruption, he said on this wise, I will give you the sure mercies of David.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherefore he saith also in another [psalm], Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell on sleep, and was laid unto his fathers, and saw corruption:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Be it known unto you therefore, men [and] brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;

Author: Luke
Sentence: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now when the congregation was broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy, and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold, and said, It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you: but seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For so hath the Lord commanded us, [saying], I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women, and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their coasts.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And it came to pass in Iconium, that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake, that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of his grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles, and also of the Jews with their rulers, to use [them] despitefully, and to stone them,

Author: Luke
Sentence: They were ware of [it], and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there they preached the gospel.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked:

Author: Luke
Sentence: The same heard Paul speak: who stedfastly beholding him, and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he leaped and walked.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the speech of Lycaonia, The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter; and Paul, Mercurius, because he was the chief speaker.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.

Author: Luke
Sentence: [Which] when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard [of], they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,

Author: Luke
Sentence: And saying, Sirs, why do ye these things?

Author: Luke
Sentence: We also are men of like passions with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all things that are therein:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there came thither [certain] Jews from Antioch and Iconium, who persuaded the people, and, having stoned Paul, drew [him] out of the city, supposing he had been dead.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Howbeit, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up, and came into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had preached the gospel to that city, and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra, and [to] Iconium, and Antioch,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Confirming the souls of the disciples, [and] exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had ordained them elders in every church, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they believed.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were come, and had gathered the church together, they rehearsed all that God had done with them, and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And there they abode long time with the disciples.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, [and said], Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.

Author: Luke
Sentence: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and [of] the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command [them] to keep the law of Moses.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men [and] brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as [he did] unto us;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

Author: Luke
Sentence: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men [and] brethren, hearken unto me:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

Author: Luke
Sentence: After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:

Author: Luke
Sentence: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:

Author: Luke
Sentence: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and [from] fornication, and [from] things strangled, and [from] blood.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; [namely], Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:

Author: Luke
Sentence: And they wrote [letters] by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren [send] greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, [Ye must] be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no [such] commandment:

Author: Luke
Sentence: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

Author: Luke
Sentence: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Luke
Sentence: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell [you] the same things by mouth.

Author: Luke
Sentence: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;

Author: Luke
Sentence: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Fare ye well.

Author: Luke
Sentence: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:

Author: Luke
Sentence: [Which] when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed [them].

Author: Luke
Sentence: And after they had tarried [there] a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, [and see] how they do.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.

Author: Luke
Sentence: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;

Author: Luke
Sentence: And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.

Author: Luke
Sentence: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father [was] a Greek:

Author: Luke
Sentence: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.

Author: Luke
Sentence: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.

Author: John
Sentence: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

Author: John
Sentence: The same was in the beginning with God.

Author: John
Sentence: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

Author: John
Sentence: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

Author: John
Sentence: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

Author: John
Sentence: There was a man sent from God, whose name [was] John.

Author: John
Sentence: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all [men] through him might believe.

Author: John
Sentence: He was not that Light, but [was sent] to bear witness of that Light.

Author: John
Sentence: [That] was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

Author: John
Sentence: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

Author: John
Sentence: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, [even] to them that believe on his name:

Author: John
Sentence: Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

Author: John
Sentence: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.

Author: John
Sentence: John bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.

Author: John
Sentence: And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.

Author: John
Sentence: For the law was given by Moses, [but] grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared [him].

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?

Author: John
Sentence: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: And they asked him, What then?

Author: John
Sentence: Art thou Elias?

Author: John
Sentence: And he saith, I am not.

Author: John
Sentence: Art thou that prophet?

Author: John
Sentence: And he answered, No.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, Who art thou?

Author: John
Sentence: that we may give an answer to them that sent us.

Author: John
Sentence: What sayest thou of thyself?

Author: John
Sentence: He said, I [am] the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.

Author: John
Sentence: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.

Author: John
Sentence: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?

Author: John
Sentence: John answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;

Author: John
Sentence: He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe’s latchet I am not worthy to unloose.

Author: John
Sentence: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

Author: John
Sentence: The next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.

Author: John
Sentence: And I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.

Author: John
Sentence: And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.

Author: John
Sentence: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.

Author: John
Sentence: Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;

Author: John
Sentence: And looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!

Author: John
Sentence: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye?

Author: John
Sentence: They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto them, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.

Author: John
Sentence: One of the two which heard John [speak], and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

Author: John
Sentence: He first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: And he brought him to Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.

Author: John
Sentence: The day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him, Follow me.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

Author: John
Sentence: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

Author: John
Sentence: And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth?

Author: John
Sentence: Philip saith unto him, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!

Author: John
Sentence: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: thou shalt see greater things than these.

Author: John
Sentence: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.

Author: John
Sentence: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

Author: John
Sentence: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

Author: John
Sentence: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee?

Author: John
Sentence: mine hour is not yet come.

Author: John
Sentence: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do [it].

Author: John
Sentence: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water.

Author: John
Sentence: And they filled them up to the brim.

Author: John
Sentence: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast.

Author: John
Sentence: And they bare [it].

Author: John
Sentence: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,

Author: John
Sentence: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: [but] thou hast kept the good wine until now.

Author: John
Sentence: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

Author: John
Sentence: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.

Author: John
Sentence: And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

Author: John
Sentence: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;

Author: John
Sentence: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.

Author: John
Sentence: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

Author: John
Sentence: Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?

Author: John
Sentence: But he spake of the temple of his body.

Author: John
Sentence: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

Author: John
Sentence: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast [day], many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.

Author: John
Sentence: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all [men],

Author: John
Sentence: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

Author: John
Sentence: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

Author: John
Sentence: The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

Author: John
Sentence: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old?

Author: John
Sentence: can he enter the second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and [of] the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.

Author: John
Sentence: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

Author: John
Sentence: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

Author: John
Sentence: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

Author: John
Sentence: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.

Author: John
Sentence: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you [of] heavenly things?

Author: John
Sentence: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, [even] the Son of man which is in heaven.

Author: John
Sentence: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:

Author: John
Sentence: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

Author: John
Sentence: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.

Author: John
Sentence: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.

Author: John
Sentence: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

Author: John
Sentence: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.

Author: John
Sentence: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.

Author: John
Sentence: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

Author: John
Sentence: And John also was baptizing in AEnon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

Author: John
Sentence: For John was not yet cast into prison.

Author: John
Sentence: Then there arose a question between [some] of John’s disciples and the Jews about purifying.

Author: John
Sentence: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all [men] come to him.

Author: John
Sentence: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.

Author: John
Sentence: He must increase, but I [must] decrease.

Author: John
Sentence: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.

Author: John
Sentence: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

Author: John
Sentence: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure [unto him].

Author: John
Sentence: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

Author: John
Sentence: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.

Author: John
Sentence: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

Author: John
Sentence: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

Author: John
Sentence: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.

Author: John
Sentence: And he must needs go through Samaria.

Author: John
Sentence: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Jacob’s well was there.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus therefore, being wearied with [his] journey, sat thus on the well: [and] it was about the sixth hour.

Author: John
Sentence: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.

Author: John
Sentence: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria?

Author: John
Sentence: for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

Author: John
Sentence: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?

Author: John
Sentence: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

Author: John
Sentence: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

Author: John
Sentence: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

Author: John
Sentence: The woman answered and said, I have no husband.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

Author: John
Sentence: For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.

Author: John
Sentence: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

Author: John
Sentence: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.

Author: John
Sentence: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.

Author: John
Sentence: God [is] a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship [him] in spirit and in truth.

Author: John
Sentence: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am [he].

Author: John
Sentence: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: or, Why talkest thou with her?

Author: John
Sentence: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

Author: John
Sentence: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

Author: John
Sentence: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

Author: John
Sentence: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him [ought] to eat?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

Author: John
Sentence: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and [then] cometh harvest?

Author: John
Sentence: behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

Author: John
Sentence: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

Author: John
Sentence: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.

Author: John
Sentence: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

Author: John
Sentence: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.

Author: John
Sentence: And many more believed because of his own word;

Author: John
Sentence: And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard [him] ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

Author: John
Sentence: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

Author: John
Sentence: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

Author: John
Sentence: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine.

Author: John
Sentence: And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

Author: John
Sentence: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.

Author: John
Sentence: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth.

Author: John
Sentence: And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.

Author: John
Sentence: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told [him], saying, Thy son liveth.

Author: John
Sentence: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend.

Author: John
Sentence: And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

Author: John
Sentence: So the father knew that [it was] at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

Author: John
Sentence: This [is] again the second miracle [that] Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.

Author: John
Sentence: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

Author: John
Sentence: Now there is at Jerusalem by the sheep [market] a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.

Author: John
Sentence: In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.

Author: John
Sentence: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.

Author: John
Sentence: And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time [in that case], he saith unto him, Wilt thou be made whole?

Author: John
Sentence: The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.

Author: John
Sentence: And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry [thy] bed.

Author: John
Sentence: He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.

Author: John
Sentence: Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?

Author: John
Sentence: And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in [that] place.

Author: John
Sentence: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.

Author: John
Sentence: The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.

Author: John
Sentence: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.

Author: John
Sentence: But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

Author: John
Sentence: Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.

Author: John
Sentence: For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.

Author: John
Sentence: For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth [them]; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.

Author: John
Sentence: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:

Author: John
Sentence: That all [men] should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

Author: John
