Sentence: For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;

Author: John
Sentence: And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.

Author: John
Sentence: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

Author: John
Sentence: And shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.

Author: John
Sentence: I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

Author: John
Sentence: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved.

Author: John
Sentence: He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.

Author: John
Sentence: But I have greater witness than [that] of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.

Author: John
Sentence: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.

Author: John
Sentence: Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.

Author: John
Sentence: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

Author: John
Sentence: I receive not honour from men.

Author: John
Sentence: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

Author: John
Sentence: I am come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.

Author: John
Sentence: How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that [cometh] from God only?

Author: John
Sentence: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is [one] that accuseth you, [even] Moses, in whom ye trust.

Author: John
Sentence: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.

Author: John
Sentence: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

Author: John
Sentence: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is [the sea] of Tiberias.

Author: John
Sentence: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus then lifted up [his] eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?

Author: John
Sentence: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.

Author: John
Sentence: Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.

Author: John
Sentence: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, saith unto him,

Author: John
Sentence: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus said, Make the men sit down.

Author: John
Sentence: Now there was much grass in the place.

Author: John
Sentence: So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.

Author: John
Sentence: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore they gathered [them] together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.

Author: John
Sentence: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.

Author: John
Sentence: And when even was [now] come, his disciples went down unto the sea,

Author: John
Sentence: And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum.

Author: John
Sentence: And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.

Author: John
Sentence: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

Author: John
Sentence: So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.

Author: John
Sentence: But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.

Author: John
Sentence: Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.

Author: John
Sentence: The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but [that] his disciples were gone away alone;

Author: John
Sentence: (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)

Author: John
Sentence: When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.

Author: John
Sentence: Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.

Author: John
Sentence: They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee?

Author: John
Sentence: what dost thou work?

Author: John
Sentence: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.

Author: John
Sentence: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.

Author: John
Sentence: But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.

Author: John
Sentence: All that the Father giveth me shall come to me; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.

Author: John
Sentence: For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the Father’s will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life: and I will raise him up at the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.

Author: John
Sentence: And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know?

Author: John
Sentence: how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.

Author: John
Sentence: No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him: and I will raise him up at the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God.

Author: John
Sentence: Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.

Author: John
Sentence: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.

Author: John
Sentence: I am that bread of life.

Author: John
Sentence: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.

Author: John
Sentence: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us [his] flesh to eat?

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.

Author: John
Sentence: Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

Author: John
Sentence: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

Author: John
Sentence: As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.

Author: John
Sentence: This is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.

Author: John
Sentence: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

Author: John
Sentence: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard [this], said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?

Author: John
Sentence: [What] and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?

Author: John
Sentence: It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you, [they] are spirit, and [they] are life.

Author: John
Sentence: But there are some of you that believe not.

Author: John
Sentence: For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.

Author: John
Sentence: And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.

Author: John
Sentence: From that [time] many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?

Author: John
Sentence: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go?

Author: John
Sentence: thou hast the words of eternal life.

Author: John
Sentence: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?

Author: John
Sentence: He spake of Judas Iscariot [the son] of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.

Author: John
Sentence: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

Author: John
Sentence: Now the Jews’ feast of tabernacles was at hand.

Author: John
Sentence: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.

Author: John
Sentence: For [there is] no man [that] doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly.

Author: John
Sentence: If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.

Author: John
Sentence: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.

Author: John
Sentence: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.

Author: John
Sentence: Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; for my time is not yet full come.

Author: John
Sentence: When he had said these words unto them, he abode [still] in Galilee.

Author: John
Sentence: But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

Author: John
Sentence: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.

Author: John
Sentence: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.

Author: John
Sentence: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

Author: John
Sentence: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or [whether] I speak of myself.

Author: John
Sentence: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Did not Moses give you the law, and [yet] none of you keepeth the law?

Author: John
Sentence: Why go ye about to kill me?

Author: John
Sentence: The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

Author: John
Sentence: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.

Author: John
Sentence: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?

Author: John
Sentence: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?

Author: John
Sentence: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?

Author: John
Sentence: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

Author: John
Sentence: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.

Author: John
Sentence: But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

Author: John
Sentence: And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this [man] hath done?

Author: John
Sentence: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and [then] I go unto him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him?

Author: John
Sentence: will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?

Author: John
Sentence: What [manner of] saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find [me]: and where I am, [thither] ye cannot come?

Author: John
Sentence: In the last day, that great [day] of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.

Author: John
Sentence: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

Author: John
Sentence: (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet [given]; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)

Author: John
Sentence: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.

Author: John
Sentence: Others said, This is the Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?

Author: John
Sentence: Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?

Author: John
Sentence: So there was a division among the people because of him.

Author: John
Sentence: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?

Author: John
Sentence: The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.

Author: John
Sentence: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?

Author: John
Sentence: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?

Author: John
Sentence: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.

Author: John
Sentence: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)

Author: John
Sentence: Doth our law judge [any] man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?

Author: John
Sentence: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee?

Author: John
Sentence: Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.

Author: John
Sentence: And every man went unto his own house.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

Author: John
Sentence: And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.

Author: John
Sentence: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery; and when they had set her in the midst,

Author: John
Sentence: They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him.

Author: John
Sentence: But Jesus stooped down, and with [his] finger wrote on the ground, [as though he heard them not].

Author: John
Sentence: So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.

Author: John
Sentence: And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.

Author: John
Sentence: And they which heard [it], being convicted by [their own] conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, [even] unto the last: and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers?

Author: John
Sentence: hath no man condemned thee?

Author: John
Sentence: She said, No man, Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.

Author: John
Sentence: Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

Author: John
Sentence: The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, [yet] my record is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.

Author: John
Sentence: And yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.

Author: John
Sentence: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father: if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.

Author: John
Sentence: These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple: and no man laid hands on him; for his hour was not yet come.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself?

Author: John
Sentence: because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.

Author: John
Sentence: And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye are of this world; I am not of this world.

Author: John
Sentence: I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am [he], ye shall die in your sins.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, Who art thou?

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus saith unto them, Even [the same] that I said unto you from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: I have many things to say and to judge of you: but he that sent me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.

Author: John
Sentence: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am [he], and [that] I do nothing of myself; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that sent me is with me: the Father hath not left me alone; for I do always those things that please him.

Author: John
Sentence: As he spake these words, many believed on him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, [then] are ye my disciples indeed;

Author: John
Sentence: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

Author: John
Sentence: They answered him, We be Abraham’s seed, and were never in bondage to any man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.

Author: John
Sentence: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever: [but] the Son abideth ever.

Author: John
Sentence: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

Author: John
Sentence: I know that ye are Abraham’s seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.

Author: John
Sentence: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.

Author: John
Sentence: They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham’s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.

Author: John
Sentence: But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God: this did not Abraham.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye do the deeds of your father.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, [even] God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: Why do ye not understand my speech?

Author: John
Sentence: [even] because ye cannot hear my word.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye are of [your] father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do.

Author: John
Sentence: He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him.

Author: John
Sentence: When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

Author: John
Sentence: And because I tell [you] the truth, ye believe me not.

Author: John
Sentence: Which of you convinceth me of sin?

Author: John
Sentence: And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?

Author: John
Sentence: He that is of God heareth God’s words: ye therefore hear [them] not, because ye are not of God.

Author: John
Sentence: Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, I have not a devil; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.

Author: John
Sentence: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil.

Author: John
Sentence: Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.

Author: John
Sentence: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead?

Author: John
Sentence: and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my Father that honoureth me; of whom ye say, that he is your God:

Author: John
Sentence: Yet ye have not known him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep his saying.

Author: John
Sentence: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day: and he saw [it], and was glad.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

Author: John
Sentence: Then took they up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.

Author: John
Sentence: And as [Jesus] passed by, he saw a man which was blind from [his] birth.

Author: John
Sentence: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

Author: John
Sentence: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

Author: John
Sentence: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,

Author: John
Sentence: And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

Author: John
Sentence: The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?

Author: John
Sentence: Some said, This is he: others [said], He is like him: [but] he said, I am [he].

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?

Author: John
Sentence: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they unto him, Where is he?

Author: John
Sentence: He said, I know not.

Author: John
Sentence: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

Author: John
Sentence: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

Author: John
Sentence: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight.

Author: John
Sentence: He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day.

Author: John
Sentence: Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles?

Author: John
Sentence: And there was a division among them.

Author: John
Sentence: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes?

Author: John
Sentence: He said, He is a prophet.

Author: John
Sentence: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.

Author: John
Sentence: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind?

Author: John
Sentence: how then doth he now see?

Author: John
Sentence: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

Author: John
Sentence: But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.

Author: John
Sentence: These [words] spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.

Author: John
Sentence: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner [or no], I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee?

Author: John
Sentence: how opened he thine eyes?

Author: John
Sentence: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear [it] again?

Author: John
Sentence: will ye also be his disciples?

Author: John
Sentence: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses’ disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: We know that God spake unto Moses: [as for] this [fellow], we know not from whence he is.

Author: John
Sentence: The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and [yet] he hath opened mine eyes.

Author: John
Sentence: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.

Author: John
Sentence: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

Author: John
Sentence: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

Author: John
Sentence: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us?

Author: John
Sentence: And they cast him out.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?

Author: John
Sentence: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.

Author: John
Sentence: And he said, Lord, I believe.

Author: John
Sentence: And he worshipped him.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

Author: John
Sentence: And [some] of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.

Author: John
Sentence: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

Author: John
Sentence: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

Author: John
Sentence: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

Author: John
Sentence: The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have [it] more abundantly.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the good shepherd, and know my [sheep], and am known of mine.

Author: John
Sentence: As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold, [and] one shepherd.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

Author: John
Sentence: No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself.

Author: John
Sentence: I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again.

Author: John
Sentence: This commandment have I received of my Father.

Author: John
Sentence: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.

Author: John
Sentence: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?

Author: John
Sentence: Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil.

Author: John
Sentence: Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

Author: John
Sentence: And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.

Author: John
Sentence: Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt?

Author: John
Sentence: If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.

Author: John
Sentence: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

Author: John
Sentence: And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any [man] pluck them out of my hand.

Author: John
Sentence: My Father, which gave [them] me, is greater than all; and no [man] is able to pluck [them] out of my Father’s hand.

Author: John
Sentence: I and [my] Father are one.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?

Author: John
Sentence: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken;

Author: John
Sentence: Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?

Author: John
Sentence: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

Author: John
Sentence: But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know, and believe, that the Father [is] in me, and I in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,

Author: John
Sentence: And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.

Author: John
Sentence: And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.

Author: John
Sentence: And many believed on him there.

Author: John
Sentence: Now a certain [man] was sick, [named] Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.

Author: John
Sentence: (It was [that] Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus heard [that], he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

Author: John
Sentence: When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.

Author: John
Sentence: Then after that saith he to [his] disciples, Let us go into Judaea again.

Author: John
Sentence: [His] disciples say unto him, Master, the Jews of late sought to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day?

Author: John
Sentence: If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.

Author: John
Sentence: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.

Author: John
Sentence: These things said he: and after that he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarus sleepeth; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.

Author: John
Sentence: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.

Author: John
Sentence: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then when Jesus came, he found that he had [lain] in the grave four days already.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off:

Author: John
Sentence: And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary sat [still] in the house.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

Author: John
Sentence: But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give [it] thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.

Author: John
Sentence: Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live:

Author: John
Sentence: And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die.

Author: John
Sentence: Believest thou this?

Author: John
Sentence: She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: And when she had so said, she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is come, and calleth for thee.

Author: John
Sentence: As soon as she heard [that], she arose quickly, and came unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, She goeth unto the grave to weep there.

Author: John
Sentence: Then when Mary was come where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,

Author: John
Sentence: And said, Where have ye laid him?

Author: John
Sentence: They said unto him, Lord, come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus wept.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him!

Author: John
Sentence: And some of them said, Could not this man, which opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave.

Author: John
Sentence: It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus said, Take ye away the stone.

Author: John
Sentence: Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been [dead] four days.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?

Author: John
Sentence: Then they took away the stone [from the place] where the dead was laid.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus lifted up [his] eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.

Author: John
Sentence: And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I said [it], that they may believe that thou hast sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.

Author: John
Sentence: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.

Author: John
Sentence: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.

Author: John
Sentence: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council, and said, What do we?

Author: John
Sentence: for this man doeth many miracles.

Author: John
Sentence: If we let him thus alone, all [men] will believe on him: and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.

Author: John
Sentence: And one of them, [named] Caiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,

Author: John
Sentence: Nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.

Author: John
Sentence: And this spake he not of himself: but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;

Author: John
Sentence: And not for that nation only, but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad.

Author: John
Sentence: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with his disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: And the Jews’ passover was nigh at hand: and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.

Author: John
Sentence: Then sought they for Jesus, and spake among themselves, as they stood in the temple, What think ye, that he will not come to the feast?

Author: John
Sentence: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that, if any man knew where he were, he should shew [it], that they might take him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.

Author: John
Sentence: There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s [son], which should betray him,

Author: John
Sentence: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

Author: John
Sentence: This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.

Author: John
Sentence: For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.

Author: John
Sentence: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

Author: John
Sentence: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;

Author: John
Sentence: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

Author: John
Sentence: Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed [is] the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,

Author: John
Sentence: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.

Author: John
Sentence: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and [that] they had done these things unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.

Author: John
Sentence: For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.

Author: John
Sentence: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing?

Author: John
Sentence: behold, the world is gone after him.

Author: John
Sentence: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:

Author: John
Sentence: The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.

Author: John
Sentence: He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.

Author: John
Sentence: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will [my] Father honour.

Author: John
Sentence: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say?

Author: John
Sentence: Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.

Author: John
Sentence: Father, glorify thy name.

Author: John
Sentence: Then came there a voice from heaven, [saying], I have both glorified [it], and will glorify [it] again.

Author: John
Sentence: The people therefore, that stood by, and heard [it], said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.

Author: John
Sentence: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

Author: John
Sentence: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all [men] unto me.

Author: John
Sentence: This he said, signifying what death he should die.

Author: John
Sentence: The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up?

Author: John
Sentence: who is this Son of man?

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you.

Author: John
Sentence: Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

Author: John
Sentence: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light.

Author: John
Sentence: These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.

Author: John
Sentence: But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:

Author: John
Sentence: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report?

Author: John
Sentence: and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

Author: John
Sentence: He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with [their] eyes, nor understand with [their] heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

Author: John
Sentence: These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

Author: John
Sentence: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess [him], lest they should be put out of the synagogue:

Author: John
Sentence: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.

Author: John
Sentence: And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

Author: John
Sentence: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.

Author: John
Sentence: For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

Author: John
Sentence: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.

Author: John
Sentence: Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.

Author: John
Sentence: And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s [son], to betray him;

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God;

Author: John
Sentence: He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.

Author: John
Sentence: After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe [them] with the towel wherewith he was girded.

Author: John
Sentence: Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

Author: John
Sentence: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

Author: John
Sentence: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also [my] hands and [my] head.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith to him, He that is washed needeth not save to wash [his] feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.

Author: John
Sentence: For he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.

Author: John
Sentence: So after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?

Author: John
Sentence: Ye call me Master and Lord: and ye say well; for [so] I am.

Author: John
Sentence: If I then, [your] Lord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.

Author: John
Sentence: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.

Author: John
Sentence: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me.

Author: John
Sentence: Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am [he].

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.

Author: John
Sentence: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.

Author: John
Sentence: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.

Author: John
Sentence: He then lying on Jesus’ breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when I have dipped [it].

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had dipped the sop, he gave [it] to Judas Iscariot, [the son] of Simon.

Author: John
Sentence: And after the sop Satan entered into him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto him, That thou doest, do quickly.

Author: John
Sentence: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.

Author: John
Sentence: For some [of them] thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buy [those things] that we have need of against the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.

Author: John
Sentence: He then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore, when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.

Author: John
Sentence: If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.

Author: John
Sentence: Little children, yet a little while I am with you.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye shall seek me: and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say to you.

Author: John
Sentence: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: By this shall all [men] know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

Author: John
Sentence: Simon Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.

Author: John
Sentence: Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now?

Author: John
Sentence: I will lay down my life for thy sake.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake?

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.

Author: John
Sentence: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

Author: John
Sentence: In my Father’s house are many mansions: if [it were] not [so], I would have told you.

Author: John
Sentence: I go to prepare a place for you.

Author: John
Sentence: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself; that where I am, [there] ye may be also.

Author: John
Sentence: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

Author: John
Sentence: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

Author: John
Sentence: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip?

Author: John
Sentence: he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou [then], Shew us the Father?

Author: John
Sentence: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me?

Author: John
Sentence: the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.

Author: John
Sentence: Believe me that I [am] in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater [works] than these shall he do; because I go unto my Father.

Author: John
Sentence: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do [it].

Author: John
Sentence: If ye love me, keep my commandments.

Author: John
Sentence: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;

Author: John
Sentence: [Even] the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.

Author: John
Sentence: I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.

Author: John
Sentence: Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.

Author: John
Sentence: At that day ye shall know that I [am] in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.

Author: John
Sentence: Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.

Author: John
Sentence: He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s which sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: These things have I spoken unto you, being [yet] present with you.

Author: John
Sentence: But the Comforter, [which is] the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come [again] unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.

Author: John
Sentence: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

Author: John
Sentence: Hereafter I will not talk much with you: for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.

Author: John
Sentence: But that the world may know that I love the Father; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do.

Author: John
Sentence: Arise, let us go hence.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

Author: John
Sentence: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every [branch] that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

Author: John
Sentence: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Abide in me, and I in you.

Author: John
Sentence: As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.

Author: John
Sentence: I am the vine, ye [are] the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

Author: John
Sentence: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast [them] into the fire, and they are burned.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.

Author: John
Sentence: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and [that] your joy might be full.

Author: John
Sentence: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.

Author: John
Sentence: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

Author: John
Sentence: Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and [that] your fruit should remain: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

Author: John
Sentence: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before [it hated] you.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own: but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

Author: John
Sentence: Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord.

Author: John
Sentence: If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.

Author: John
Sentence: But all these things will they do unto you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no cloke for their sin.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

Author: John
Sentence: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.

Author: John
Sentence: But [this cometh to pass], that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

Author: John
Sentence: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, [even] the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me:

Author: John
Sentence: And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

Author: John
Sentence: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.

Author: John
Sentence: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

Author: John
Sentence: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them.

Author: John
Sentence: And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.

Author: John
Sentence: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

Author: John
Sentence: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Author: John
Sentence: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

Author: John
Sentence: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

Author: John
Sentence: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

Author: John
Sentence: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

Author: John
Sentence: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, [that] shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.

Author: John
Sentence: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew [it] unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew [it] unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said [some] of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

Author: John
Sentence: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while?

Author: John
Sentence: we cannot tell what he saith.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye inquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

Author: John
Sentence: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

Author: John
Sentence: And in that day ye shall ask me nothing.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give [it] you.

Author: John
Sentence: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

Author: John
Sentence: These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:

Author: John
Sentence: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

Author: John
Sentence: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

Author: John
Sentence: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

Author: John
Sentence: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace.

Author: John
Sentence: In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

Author: John
Sentence: These words spake Jesus, and lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee:

Author: John
Sentence: As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

Author: John
Sentence: I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

Author: John
Sentence: And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.

Author: John
Sentence: I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have kept thy word.

Author: John
Sentence: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.

Author: John
Sentence: For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received [them], and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.

Author: John
Sentence: I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me; for they are thine.

Author: John
Sentence: And all mine are thine, and thine are mine; and I am glorified in them.

Author: John
Sentence: And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we [are].

Author: John
Sentence: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name: those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.

Author: John
Sentence: And now come I to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

Author: John
Sentence: I have given them thy word; and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.

Author: John
Sentence: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Author: John
Sentence: As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word;

Author: John
Sentence: That they all may be one; as thou, Father, [art] in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one:

Author: John
Sentence: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.

Author: John
Sentence: Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: O righteous Father, the world hath not known thee: but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.

Author: John
Sentence: And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare [it]: that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: Judas then, having received a band [of men] and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?

Author: John
Sentence: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, I am [he].

Author: John
Sentence: And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.

Author: John
Sentence: As soon then as he had said unto them, I am [he], they went backward, and fell to the ground.

Author: John
Sentence: Then asked he them again, Whom seek ye?

Author: John
Sentence: And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, I have told you that I am [he]: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:

Author: John
Sentence: That the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear.

Author: John
Sentence: The servant’s name was Malchus.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?

Author: John
Sentence: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,

Author: John
Sentence: And led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

Author: John
Sentence: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and [so did] another disciple: that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.

Author: John
Sentence: But Peter stood at the door without.

Author: John
Sentence: Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also [one] of this man’s disciples?

Author: John
Sentence: He saith, I am not.

Author: John
Sentence: And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.

Author: John
Sentence: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, I spake openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort; and in secret have I said nothing.

Author: John
Sentence: Why askest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them: behold, they know what I said.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.

Author: John
Sentence: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself.

Author: John
Sentence: They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also [one] of his disciples?

Author: John
Sentence: He denied [it], and said, I am not.

Author: John
Sentence: One of the servants of the high priest, being [his] kinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

Author: John
Sentence: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

Author: John
Sentence: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?

Author: John
Sentence: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:

Author: John
Sentence: That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew?

Author: John
