Sentence: Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king.

Author: John
Sentence: To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate saith unto him, What is truth?

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault [at all].

Author: John
Sentence: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

Author: John
Sentence: Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas.

Author: John
Sentence: Now Barabbas was a robber.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged [him].

Author: John
Sentence: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put [it] on his head, and they put on him a purple robe,

Author: John
Sentence: And said, Hail, King of the Jews!

Author: John
Sentence: and they smote him with their hands.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe.

Author: John
Sentence: And [Pilate] saith unto them, Behold the man!

Author: John
Sentence: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify [him], crucify [him].

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucify [him]: for I find no fault in him.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

Author: John
Sentence: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;

Author: John
Sentence: And went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou?

Author: John
Sentence: But Jesus gave him no answer.

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me?

Author: John
Sentence: knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power [at all] against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.

Author: John
Sentence: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.

Author: John
Sentence: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.

Author: John
Sentence: And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour: and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King!

Author: John
Sentence: But they cried out, Away with [him], away with [him], crucify him.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King?

Author: John
Sentence: The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.

Author: John
Sentence: Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified.

Author: John
Sentence: And they took Jesus, and led [him] away.

Author: John
Sentence: And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called [the place] of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha:

Author: John
Sentence: Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.

Author: John
Sentence: And Pilate wrote a title, and put [it] on the cross.

Author: John
Sentence: And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Author: John
Sentence: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, [and] Greek, [and] Latin.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.

Author: John
Sentence: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also [his] coat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

Author: John
Sentence: They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots.

Author: John
Sentence: These things therefore the soldiers did.

Author: John
Sentence: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the [wife] of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son!

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother!

Author: John
Sentence: And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own [home].

Author: John
Sentence: After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.

Author: John
Sentence: Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar: and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and put [it] upon hyssop, and put [it] to his mouth.

Author: John
Sentence: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

Author: John
Sentence: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and [that] they might be taken away.

Author: John
Sentence: Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.

Author: John
Sentence: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:

Author: John
Sentence: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that saw [it] bare record, and his record is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.

Author: John
Sentence: For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.

Author: John
Sentence: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.

Author: John
Sentence: And after this Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave [him] leave.

Author: John
Sentence: He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound [weight].

Author: John
Sentence: Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.

Author: John
Sentence: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.

Author: John
Sentence: There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews’ preparation [day]; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.

Author: John
Sentence: The first [day] of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.

Author: John
Sentence: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.

Author: John
Sentence: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

Author: John
Sentence: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

Author: John
Sentence: And he stooping down, [and looking in], saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.

Author: John
Sentence: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,

Author: John
Sentence: And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

Author: John
Sentence: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

Author: John
Sentence: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.

Author: John
Sentence: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down, [and looked] into the sepulchre,

Author: John
Sentence: And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

Author: John
Sentence: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.

Author: John
Sentence: And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: whom seekest thou?

Author: John
Sentence: She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Mary.

Author: John
Sentence: She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and [to] my God, and your God.

Author: John
Sentence: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and [that] he had spoken these things unto her.

Author: John
Sentence: Then the same day at evening, being the first [day] of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace [be] unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had so said, he shewed unto them [his] hands and his side.

Author: John
Sentence: Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: Then said Jesus to them again, Peace [be] unto you: as [my] Father hath sent me, even so send I you.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had said this, he breathed on [them], and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:

Author: John
Sentence: Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; [and] whose soever [sins] ye retain, they are retained.

Author: John
Sentence: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

Author: John
Sentence: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.

Author: John
Sentence: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them: [then] came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace [be] unto you.

Author: John
Sentence: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust [it] into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.

Author: John
Sentence: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed [are] they that have not seen, and [yet] have believed.

Author: John
Sentence: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:

Author: John
Sentence: But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.

Author: John
Sentence: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he [himself].

Author: John
Sentence: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the [sons] of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.

Author: John
Sentence: Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing.

Author: John
Sentence: They say unto him, We also go with thee.

Author: John
Sentence: They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.

Author: John
Sentence: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Jesus saith unto them, Children, have ye any meat?

Author: John
Sentence: They answered him, No.

Author: John
Sentence: And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find.

Author: John
Sentence: They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

Author: John
Sentence: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt [his] fisher’s coat [unto him], (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.

Author: John
Sentence: And the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.

Author: John
Sentence: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.

Author: John
Sentence: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto them, Come [and] dine.

Author: John
Sentence: And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou?

Author: John
Sentence: knowing that it was the Lord.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.

Author: John
Sentence: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

Author: John
Sentence: So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, [son] of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these?

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee.

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.

Author: John
Sentence: He saith to him again the second time, Simon, [son] of Jonas, lovest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee.

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto him, Feed my sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: He saith unto him the third time, Simon, [son] of Jonas, lovest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me?

Author: John
Sentence: And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.

Author: John
Sentence: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry [thee] whither thou wouldest not.

Author: John
Sentence: This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.

Author: John
Sentence: Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?

Author: John
Sentence: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what [shall] this man [do]?

Author: John
Sentence: Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what [is that] to thee?

Author: John
Sentence: follow thou me.

Author: John
Sentence: Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what [is that] to thee?

Author: John
Sentence: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

Author: John
Sentence: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written.

Author: John
Sentence: Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;

Author: John
Sentence: (For the life was manifested, and we have seen [it], and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us;)

Author: John
Sentence: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship [is] with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.

Author: John
Sentence: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.

Author: John
Sentence: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not the truth:

Author: John
Sentence: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

Author: John
Sentence: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Author: John
Sentence: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us [our] sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Author: John
Sentence: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

Author: John
Sentence: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not.

Author: John
Sentence: And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:

Author: John
Sentence: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for [the sins of] the whole world.

Author: John
Sentence: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.

Author: John
Sentence: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.

Author: John
Sentence: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.

Author: John
Sentence: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

Author: John
Sentence: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.

Author: John
Sentence: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.

Author: John
Sentence: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.

Author: John
Sentence: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Author: John
Sentence: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.

Author: John
Sentence: I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked one.

Author: John
Sentence: I write unto you, little children, because ye have known the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one.

Author: John
Sentence: Love not the world, neither the things [that are] in the world.

Author: John
Sentence: If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

Author: John
Sentence: For all that [is] in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.

Author: John
Sentence: Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last time.

Author: John
Sentence: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would [no doubt] have continued with us: but [they went out], that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

Author: John
Sentence: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and ye know all things.

Author: John
Sentence: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ?

Author: John
Sentence: He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: [(but) he that acknowledgeth the Son hath the Father also].

Author: John
Sentence: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the promise that he hath promised us, [even] eternal life.

Author: John
Sentence: These [things] have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.

Author: John
Sentence: But the anointing which ye have received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as it hath taught you, ye shall abide in him.

Author: John
Sentence: And now, little children, abide in him; that, when he shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

Author: John
Sentence: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one that doeth righteousness is born of him.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew him not.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is.

Author: John
Sentence: And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself, even as he is pure.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is the transgression of the law.

Author: John
Sentence: And ye know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.

Author: John
Sentence: Little children, let no man deceive you: he that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

Author: John
Sentence: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning.

Author: John
Sentence: For this purpose the Son of God was manifested, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

Author: John
Sentence: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil: whosoever doeth not righteousness is not of God, neither he that loveth not his brother.

Author: John
Sentence: For this is the message that ye heard from the beginning, that we should love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: Not as Cain, [who] was of that wicked one, and slew his brother.

Author: John
Sentence: And wherefore slew he him?

Author: John
Sentence: Because his own works were evil, and his brother’s righteous.

Author: John
Sentence: Marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

Author: John
Sentence: We know that we have passed from death unto life, because we love the brethren.

Author: John
Sentence: He that loveth not [his] brother abideth in death.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Hereby perceive we the love [of God], because he laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down [our] lives for the brethren.

Author: John
Sentence: But whoso hath this world’s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels [of compassion] from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?

Author: John
Sentence: My little children, let us not love in word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

Author: John
Sentence: And hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him.

Author: John
Sentence: For if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart, and knoweth all things.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, [then] have we confidence toward God.

Author: John
Sentence: And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is his commandment, That we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and love one another, as he gave us commandment.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that keepeth his commandments dwelleth in him, and he in him.

Author: John
Sentence: And hereby we know that he abideth in us, by the Spirit which he hath given us.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Hereby know ye the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:

Author: John
Sentence: And every spirit that confesseth not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God: and this is that [spirit] of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that it should come; and even now already is it in the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Author: John
Sentence: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world, and the world heareth them.

Author: John
Sentence: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us.

Author: John
Sentence: Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

Author: John
Sentence: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.

Author: John
Sentence: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

Author: John
Sentence: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son [to be] the propitiation for our sins.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: No man hath seen God at any time.

Author: John
Sentence: If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.

Author: John
Sentence: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.

Author: John
Sentence: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son [to be] the Saviour of the world.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

Author: John
Sentence: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us.

Author: John
Sentence: God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.

Author: John
Sentence: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.

Author: John
Sentence: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment.

Author: John
Sentence: He that feareth is not made perfect in love.

Author: John
Sentence: We love him, because he first loved us.

Author: John
Sentence: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?

Author: John
Sentence: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.

Author: John
Sentence: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

Author: John
Sentence: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.

Author: John
Sentence: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, [even] our faith.

Author: John
Sentence: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Author: John
Sentence: This is he that came by water and blood, [even] Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood.

Author: John
Sentence: And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.

Author: John
Sentence: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.

Author: John
Sentence: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.

Author: John
Sentence: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.

Author: John
Sentence: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath the Son hath life; [and] he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.

Author: John
Sentence: These things have I written unto you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that ye may know that ye have eternal life, and that ye may believe on the name of the Son of God.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:

Author: John
Sentence: And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.

Author: John
Sentence: If any man see his brother sin a sin [which is] not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death.

Author: John
Sentence: There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.

Author: John
Sentence: All unrighteousness is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

Author: John
Sentence: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not; but he that is begotten of God keepeth himself, and that wicked one toucheth him not.

Author: John
Sentence: [And] we know that we are of God, and the whole world lieth in wickedness.

Author: John
Sentence: And we know that the Son of God is come, and hath given us an understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him that is true, [even] in his Son Jesus Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: This is the true God, and eternal life.

Author: John
Sentence: Little children, keep yourselves from idols.

Author: John
Sentence: Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: The elder unto the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth; and not I only, but also all they that have known the truth;

Author: John
Sentence: For the truth’s sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be with us for ever.

Author: John
Sentence: Grace be with you, mercy, [and] peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

Author: John
Sentence: I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

Author: John
Sentence: And now I beseech thee, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment unto thee, but that which we had from the beginning, that we love one another.

Author: John
Sentence: And this is love, that we walk after his commandments.

Author: John
Sentence: This is the commandment, That, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk in it.

Author: John
Sentence: For many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh.

Author: John
Sentence: This is a deceiver and an antichrist.

Author: John
Sentence: Look to yourselves, that we lose not those things which we have wrought, but that we receive a full reward.

Author: John
Sentence: Whosoever transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrine of Christ, hath not God.

Author: John
Sentence: He that abideth in the doctrine of Christ, he hath both the Father and the Son.

Author: John
Sentence: If there come any unto you, and bring not this doctrine, receive him not into [your] house, neither bid him God speed:

Author: John
Sentence: For he that biddeth him God speed is partaker of his evil deeds.

Author: John
Sentence: Having many things to write unto you, I would not [write] with paper and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak face to face, that our joy may be full.

Author: John
Sentence: The children of thy elect sister greet thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

Author: John
Sentence: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

Author: John
Sentence: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:

Author: John
Sentence: Because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.

Author: John
Sentence: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.

Author: John
Sentence: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.

Author: John
Sentence: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth [them] out of the church.

Author: John
Sentence: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good.

Author: John
Sentence: He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

Author: John
Sentence: Demetrius hath good report of all [men], and of the truth itself: yea, and we [also] bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

Author: John
Sentence: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:

Author: John
Sentence: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face.

Author: John
Sentence: Peace [be] to thee.

Author: John
Sentence: [Our] friends salute thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Greet the friends by name.

Author: John
Sentence: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass; and he sent and signified [it] by his angel unto his servant John:

Author: John
Sentence: Who bare record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.

Author: John
Sentence: Blessed [is] he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written therein: for the time [is] at hand.

Author: John
Sentence: John to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne;

Author: John
Sentence: And from Jesus Christ, [who is] the faithful witness, [and] the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth.

Author: John
Sentence: Unto him that loved us, and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

Author: John
Sentence: And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him [be] glory and dominion for ever and ever.

Author: John
Sentence: Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they [also] which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him.

Author: John
Sentence: Even so, Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

Author: John
Sentence: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

Author: John
Sentence: I was in the Spirit on the Lord’s day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

Author: John
Sentence: Saying, I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What thou seest, write in a book, and send [it] unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.

Author: John
Sentence: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me.

Author: John
Sentence: And being turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks;

Author: John
Sentence: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks [one] like unto the Son of man, clothed with a garment down to the foot, and girt about the paps with a golden girdle.

Author: John
Sentence: His head and [his] hairs [were] white like wool, as white as snow; and his eyes [were] as a flame of fire;

Author: John
Sentence: And his feet like unto fine brass, as if they burned in a furnace; and his voice as the sound of many waters.

Author: John
Sentence: And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his countenance [was] as the sun shineth in his strength.

Author: John
Sentence: And when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead.

Author: John
Sentence: And he laid his right hand upon me, saying unto me, Fear not; I am the first and the last:

Author: John
Sentence: [I am] he that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death.

Author: John
Sentence: Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;

Author: John
Sentence: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks.

Author: John
Sentence: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches: and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches.

Author: John
Sentence: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works, and thy labour, and thy patience, and how thou canst not bear them which are evil: and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles, and are not, and hast found them liars:

Author: John
Sentence: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name’s sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

Author: John
Sentence: Nevertheless I have [somewhat] against thee, because thou hast left thy first love.

Author: John
Sentence: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will remove thy candlestick out of his place, except thou repent.

Author: John
Sentence: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the midst of the paradise of God.

Author: John
Sentence: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and [I know] the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews, and are not, but [are] the synagogue of Satan.

Author: John
Sentence: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer: behold, the devil shall cast [some] of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye shall have tribulation ten days: be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.

Author: John
Sentence: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works, and where thou dwellest, [even] where Satan’s seat [is]: and thou holdest fast my name, and hast not denied my faith, even in those days wherein Antipas [was] my faithful martyr, who was slain among you, where Satan dwelleth.

Author: John
Sentence: But I have a few things against thee, because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed unto idols, and to commit fornication.

Author: John
Sentence: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.

Author: John
Sentence: Repent; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name written, which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth [it].

Author: John
Sentence: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet [are] like fine brass;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last [to be] more than the first.

Author: John
Sentence: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee, because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication, and to eat things sacrificed unto idols.

Author: John
Sentence: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.

Author: John
Sentence: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.

Author: John
Sentence: But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.

Author: John
Sentence: But that which ye have [already] hold fast till I come.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations:

Author: John
Sentence: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

Author: John
Sentence: And I will give him the morning star.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Author: John
Sentence: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

Author: John
Sentence: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

Author: John
Sentence: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent.

Author: John
Sentence: If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.

Author: John
Sentence: He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Author: John
Sentence: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write; These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.

Author: John
Sentence: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

Author: John
Sentence: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, [which is] new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God: and [I will write upon him] my new name.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Author: John
Sentence: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;

Author: John
Sentence: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.

Author: John
Sentence: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.

Author: John
Sentence: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:

Author: John
Sentence: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and [that] the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

Author: John
Sentence: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

Author: John
Sentence: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

Author: John
Sentence: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.

Author: John
Sentence: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

Author: John
Sentence: After this I looked, and, behold, a door [was] opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard [was] as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.

Author: John
Sentence: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and [one] sat on the throne.

Author: John
Sentence: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: and [there was] a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

Author: John
Sentence: And round about the throne [were] four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

Author: John
Sentence: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and [there were] seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

Author: John
Sentence: And before the throne [there was] a sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, [were] four beasts full of eyes before and behind.

Author: John
Sentence: And the first beast [was] like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast [was] like a flying eagle.

Author: John
Sentence: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about [him]; and [they were] full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.

Author: John
Sentence: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,

Author: John
Sentence: The four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,

Author: John
Sentence: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?

Author: John
Sentence: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.

Author: John
Sentence: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.

Author: John
Sentence: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.

Author: John
Sentence: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

Author: John
Sentence: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four [and] twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

Author: John
Sentence: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;

Author: John
Sentence: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

Author: John
Sentence: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;

Author: John
Sentence: Saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.

Author: John
Sentence: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, [be] unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

Author: John
Sentence: And the four beasts said, Amen.

Author: John
Sentence: And the four [and] twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: And there went out another horse [that was] red: and [power] was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.

Author: John
Sentence: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and [see] thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.

Author: John
Sentence: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him.

Author: John
Sentence: And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

Author: John
Sentence: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:

Author: John
Sentence: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

Author: John
Sentence: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as they [were], should be fulfilled.

Author: John
Sentence: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;

Author: John
Sentence: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.

Author: John
Sentence: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

Author: John
Sentence: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;

Author: John
Sentence: And said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:

Author: John
Sentence: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?

Author: John
Sentence: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.

Author: John
Sentence: And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God: and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

Author: John
Sentence: Saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.

Author: John
Sentence: And I heard the number of them which were sealed: [and there were] sealed an hundred [and] forty [and] four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.

Author: John
Sentence: Of the tribe of Juda [were] sealed twelve thousand.

Author: John
Sentence: Of the tribe of Reuben [were] sealed twelve thousand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called [to be] an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God,

Author: Paul
Sentence: (Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord, which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And declared [to be] the Son of God with power, according to the spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead:

Author: Paul
Sentence: By whom we have received grace and apostleship, for obedience to the faith among all nations, for his name:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called [to be] saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Making request, if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift, to the end ye may be established;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That is, that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you, (but was let hitherto,) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I am debtor both to the Greeks, and to the Barbarians; both to the wise, and to the unwise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written, The just shall live by faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed [it] unto them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, [even] his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because that, when they knew God, they glorified [him] not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And even as they did not like to retain God in [their] knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there is no respect of persons with God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For not the hearers of the law [are] just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and [their] thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And knowest [his] will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

Author: Paul
Sentence: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself?

Author: Paul
Sentence: thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery?

Author: Paul
Sentence: thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither [is that] circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he [is] a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision [is that] of the heart, in the spirit, [and] not in the letter; whose praise [is] not of men, but of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What advantage then hath the Jew?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or what profit [is there] of circumcision?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what if some did not believe?

Author: Paul
Sentence: shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Is] God unrighteous who taketh vengeance?

Author: Paul
Sentence: (I speak as a man)

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not [rather], (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come?

Author: Paul
Sentence: whose damnation is just.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: are we better [than they]?

Author: Paul
Sentence: No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

Author: Paul
Sentence: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:

Author: Paul
Sentence: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Their throat [is] an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps [is] under their lips:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whose mouth [is] full of cursing and bitterness:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Their feet [are] swift to shed blood:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Destruction and misery [are] in their ways:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the way of peace have they not known:

Author: Paul
Sentence: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law [is] the knowledge of sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even the righteousness of God [which is] by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whom God hath set forth [to be] a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To declare, [I say], at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Where [is] boasting then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is excluded.

Author: Paul
Sentence: By what law?

Author: Paul
Sentence: of works?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay: but by the law of faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Is he] the God of the Jews only?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [is he] not also of the Gentiles?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yes, of the Gentiles also:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing [it is] one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do we then make void the law through faith?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid: yea, we establish the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we say then that Abraham our father, as pertaining to the flesh, hath found?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if Abraham were justified by works, he hath [whereof] to glory; but not before God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what saith the scripture?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Abraham believed God, and it was counted unto him for righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man, unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works,

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Saying], Blessed [are] they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Blessed [is] the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Cometh] this blessedness then upon the circumcision [only], or upon the uncircumcision also?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: How was it then reckoned?

Author: Paul
Sentence: when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which [he had yet] being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which [he had] being [yet] uncircumcised.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, [was] not to Abraham, or to his seed, through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if they which are of the law [be] heirs, faith is made void, and the promise made of none effect:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is, [there is] no transgression.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore [it is] of faith, that [it might be] by grace; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed; not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham; who is the father of us all,

Author: Paul
Sentence: (As it is written, I have made thee a father of many nations,) before him whom he believed, [even] God, who quickeneth the dead, and calleth those things which be not as though they were.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who against hope believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations; according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And being not weak in faith, he considered not his own body now dead, when he was about an hundred years old, neither yet the deadness of Sara’s womb:

Author: Paul
Sentence: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief; but was strong in faith, giving glory to God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not only [so], but we glory in tribulations also: knowing that tribulation worketh patience;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And patience, experience; and experience, hope:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die: yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not only [so], but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, as by one man sin entered into the world, and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam’s transgression, who is the figure of him that was to come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But not as the offence, so also [is] the free gift.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if through the offence of one many be dead, much more the grace of God, and the gift by grace, [which is] by one man, Jesus Christ, hath abounded unto many.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not as [it was] by one that sinned, [so is] the gift: for the judgment [was] by one to condemnation, but the free gift [is] of many offences unto justification.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if by one man’s offence death reigned by one; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one, Jesus Christ.)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore as by the offence of one [judgment came] upon all men to condemnation; even so by the righteousness of one [the free gift came] upon all men unto justification of life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as by one man’s disobedience many were made sinners, so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover the law entered, that the offence might abound.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But where sin abounded, grace did much more abound:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That as sin hath reigned unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we say then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not, that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death: that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death, we shall be also [in the likeness] of [his] resurrection:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with [him], that the body of sin might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serve sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that is dead is freed from sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.

Author: Paul
