Sentence: Neither yield ye your members [as] instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members [as] instruments of righteousness unto God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under the law, but under grace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh: for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for the end of those things [is] death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the wages of sin [is] death; but the gift of God [is] eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to [her] husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of [her] husband.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then if, while [her] husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another, [even] to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For when we were in the flesh, the motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not [in] the oldness of the letter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we say then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Is] the law sin?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For without the law sin [was] dead.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the commandment, which [was ordained] to life, I found [to be] unto death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew [me].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore the law [is] holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Was then that which is good made death unto me?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that [it is] good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but [how] to perform that which is good I find not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.

Author: Paul
Sentence: O wretched man that I am!

Author: Paul
Sentence: who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [There is] therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For to be carnally minded [is] death; but to be spiritually minded [is] life and peace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because the carnal mind [is] enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if Christ [be] in you, the body [is] dead because of sin; but the Spirit [is] life because of righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with [him], that we may be also glorified together.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time [are] not worthy [to be compared] with the glory which shall be revealed in us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected [the same] in hope,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not only [they], but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, [to wit], the redemption of our body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if we hope for that we see not, [then] do we with patience wait for [it].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what [is] the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to [the will of] God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to [his] purpose.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate [to be] conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we then say to these things?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If God [be] for us, who [can be] against us?

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God’s elect?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It is] God that justifieth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who [is] he that condemneth?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It is] Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [shall] tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?

Author: Paul
Sentence: As it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost,

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who are Israelites; to whom [pertaineth] the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service [of God], and the promises;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whose [are] the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ [came], who is over all, God blessed for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they [are] not all Israel, which are of Israel:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither, because they are the seed of Abraham, [are they] all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.

Author: Paul
Sentence: That is, They which are the children of the flesh, these [are] not the children of God: but the children of the promise are counted for the seed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this [is] the word of promise, At this time will I come, and Sara shall have a son.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not only [this]; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one, [even] by our father Isaac;

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For [the children] being not yet born, neither having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: It was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we say then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Is there] unrighteousness with God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then [it is] not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will [have mercy], and whom he will he hardeneth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For who hath resisted his will?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Shall the thing formed say to him that formed [it], Why hast thou made me thus?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [What] if God, willing to shew [his] wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had afore prepared unto glory,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?

Author: Paul
Sentence: As he saith also in Osee, I will call them my people, which were not my people; and her beloved, which was not beloved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And it shall come to pass, [that] in the place where it was said unto them, Ye [are] not my people; there shall they be called the children of the living God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he will finish the work, and cut [it] short in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And as Esaias said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall we say then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, hath not attained to the law of righteousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because [they sought it] not by faith, but as it were by the works of the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;

Author: Paul
Sentence: As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Brethren, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and going about to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Christ [is] the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law, That the man which doeth those things shall live by them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, Who shall ascend into heaven?

Author: Paul
Sentence: (that is, to bring Christ down [from above]:)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or, Who shall descend into the deep?

Author: Paul
Sentence: (that is, to bring up Christ again from the dead.)

Author: Paul
Sentence: But what saith it?

Author: Paul
Sentence: The word is nigh thee, [even] in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and how shall they hear without a preacher?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And how shall they preach, except they be sent?

Author: Paul
Sentence: as it is written, How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tidings of good things!

Author: Paul
Sentence: But they have not all obeyed the gospel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Esaias saith, Lord, who hath believed our report?

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then faith [cometh] by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I say, Have they not heard?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yes verily, their sound went into all the earth, and their words unto the ends of the world.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I say, Did not Israel know?

Author: Paul
Sentence: First Moses saith, I will provoke you to jealousy by [them that are] no people, [and] by a foolish nation I will anger you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But Esaias is very bold, and saith, I was found of them that sought me not; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to Israel he saith, All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I say then, Hath God cast away his people?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, [of] the tribe of Benjamin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias?

Author: Paul
Sentence: how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But what saith the answer of God unto him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to [the image of] Baal.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if by grace, then [is it] no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if [it be] of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded

Author: Paul
Sentence: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid: but [rather] through their fall salvation [is come] unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if the fall of them [be] the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If by any means I may provoke to emulation [them which are] my flesh, and might save some of them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the casting away of them [be] the reconciling of the world, what [shall] the receiving [of them be], but life from the dead?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the firstfruit [be] holy, the lump [is] also [holy]: and if the root [be] holy, so [are] the branches.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert graffed in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Boast not against the branches.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not highminded, but fear:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if God spared not the natural branches, [take heed] lest he also spare not thee.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in [his] goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be graffed in: for God is able to graff them in again.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural [branches], be graffed into their own olive tree?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this [is] my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As concerning the gospel, [they are] enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, [they are] beloved for the fathers’ sakes.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the gifts and calling of God [are] without repentance.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God!

Author: Paul
Sentence: how unsearchable [are] his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

Author: Paul
Sentence: For who hath known the mind of the Lord?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or who hath been his counseller?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For of him, and through him, and to him, [are] all things: to whom [be] glory for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, [which is] your reasonable service.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what [is] that good, and acceptable, and perfect, will of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think [of himself] more highly than he ought to think; but to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

Author: Paul
Sentence: So we, [being] many, are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy, [let us prophesy] according to the proportion of faith;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or ministry, [let us wait] on [our] ministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he that giveth, [let him do it] with simplicity; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Let] love be without dissimulation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Be] kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Be] of the same mind one toward another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not wise in your own conceits.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Recompense to no man evil for evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Provide things honest in the sight of all men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but [rather] give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance [is] mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power?

Author: Paul
Sentence: do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise of the same:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he is the minister of God to thee for good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minister of God, a revenger to [execute] wrath upon him that doeth evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore [ye] must needs be subject, not only for wrath, but also for conscience sake.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God’s ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Render therefore to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute [is due]; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, Thou shalt not covet; and if [there be] any other commandment, it is briefly comprehended in this saying, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour: therefore love [is] the fulfilling of the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that, knowing the time, that now [it is] high time to awake out of sleep: for now [is] our salvation nearer than when we believed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and envying.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to [fulfil] the lusts [thereof].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, [but] not to doubtful disputations.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant?

Author: Paul
Sentence: to his own master he standeth or falleth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day [alike].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that regardeth the day, regardeth [it] unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard [it].

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But why dost thou judge thy brother?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or why dost thou set at nought thy brother?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is written, [As] I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in [his] brother’s way.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that [there is] nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him [it is] unclean.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if thy brother be grieved with [thy] meat, now walkest thou not charitably.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that in these things serveth Christ [is] acceptable to God, and approved of men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For meat destroy not the work of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All things indeed [are] pure; but [it is] evil for that man who eateth with offence.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [It is] good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor [any thing] whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Hast thou faith?

Author: Paul
Sentence: have [it] to thyself before God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Happy [is] he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because [he eateth] not of faith: for whatsoever [is] not of faith is sin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let every one of us please [his] neighbour for [his] good to edification.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye may with one mind [and] one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises [made] unto the fathers:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for [his] mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles, and sing unto thy name.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, Esaias saith, There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him shall the Gentiles trust.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man’s foundation:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with your [company].

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.

Author: Paul
Sentence: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ’s sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in [your] prayers to God for me;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea; and that my service which [I have] for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the God of peace [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Likewise [greet] the church that is in their house.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute my wellbeloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellowprisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Apelles approved in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute them which are of Aristobulus’ [household].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Herodion my kinsman.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet them that be of the [household] of Narcissus, which are in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labour in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute the beloved Persis, which laboured much in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Salute one another with an holy kiss.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The churches of Christ salute you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For your obedience is come abroad unto all [men].

Author: Paul
Sentence: I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I Tertius, who wrote [this] epistle, salute you in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Gaius mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you, and Quartus a brother.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To God only wise, [be] glory through Jesus Christ for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, called [to be] an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes [our] brother,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Unto the church of God which is at Corinth, to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called [to be] saints, with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both theirs and ours:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and [in] all knowledge;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

Author: Paul
Sentence: So that ye come behind in no gift; waiting for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who shall also confirm you unto the end, [that ye may be] blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: God [is] faithful, by whom ye were called unto the fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and [that] there be no divisions among you; but [that] ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it hath been declared unto me of you, my brethren, by them [which are of the house] of Chloe, that there are contentions among you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now this I say, that every one of you saith, I am of Paul; and I of Apollos; and I of Cephas; and I of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Is Christ divided?

Author: Paul
Sentence: was Paul crucified for you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or were ye baptized in the name of Paul?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas: besides, I know not whether I baptized any other.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not with wisdom of words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Where [is] the wise?

Author: Paul
Sentence: where [is] the scribe?

Author: Paul
Sentence: where [is] the disputer of this world?

Author: Paul
Sentence: hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we preach Christ crucified, unto the Jews a stumblingblock, and unto the Greeks foolishness;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But unto them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men; and the weakness of God is stronger than men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, [are called]:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And base things of the world, and things which are despised, hath God chosen, [yea], and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That no flesh should glory in his presence.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That, according as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I, brethren, when I came to you, came not with excellency of speech or of wisdom, declaring unto you the testimony of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ, and him crucified.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And my speech and my preaching [was] not with enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the princes of this world, that come to nought:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, [even] the hidden [wisdom], which God ordained before the world unto our glory:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which none of the princes of this world knew: for had they known [it], they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But as it is written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God hath revealed [them] unto us by his Spirit: for the Spirit searcheth all things, yea, the deep things of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Which things also we speak, not in the words which man’s wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know [them], because they are spiritually discerned.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that is spiritual judgeth all things, yet he himself is judged of no man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we have the mind of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, [even] as unto babes in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able [to bear it], neither yet now are ye able.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas [there is] among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I [am] of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who then is Paul, and who [is] Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God’s husbandry, [ye are] God’s building.

Author: Paul
Sentence: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Every man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man’s work of what sort it is.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man’s work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and [that] the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which [temple] ye are.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man deceive himself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore let no man glory in men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For all things are yours;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And ye are Christ’s; and Christ [is] God’s.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let a man so account of us, as of the ministers of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man’s judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and [to] Apollos for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to think [of men] above that which is written, that no one of you be puffed up for one against another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For who maketh thee to differ [from another]?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and what hast thou that thou didst not receive?

Author: Paul
Sentence: now if thou didst receive [it], why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received [it]?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We [are] fools for Christ’s sake, but ye [are] wise in Christ; we [are] weak, but ye [are] strong; ye [are] honourable, but we [are] despised.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even unto this present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world, [and are] the offscouring of all things unto this day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn [you].

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though ye have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet [have ye] not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, who is my beloved son, and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ, as I teach every where in every church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will, and will know, not the speech of them which are puffed up, but the power.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the kingdom of God [is] not in word, but in power.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What will ye?

Author: Paul
Sentence: shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, and [in] the spirit of meekness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is reported commonly [that there is] fornication among you, and such fornication as is not so much as named among the Gentiles, that one should have his father’s wife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And ye are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have judged already, as though I were present, [concerning] him that hath so done this deed,

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when ye are gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Your glorying [is] not good.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Purge out therefore the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness; but with the unleavened [bread] of sincerity and truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the covetous, or extortioners, or with idolaters; for then must ye needs go out of the world.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater, or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not to eat.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without?

Author: Paul
Sentence: do not ye judge them that are within?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But them that are without God judgeth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to law before the unjust, and not before the saints?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and if the world shall be judged by you, are ye unworthy to judge the smallest matters?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that we shall judge angels?

Author: Paul
Sentence: how much more things that pertain to this life?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If then ye have judgments of things pertaining to this life, set them to judge who are least esteemed in the church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak to your shame.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brethren?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But brother goeth to law with brother, and that before the unbelievers.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now therefore there is utterly a fault among you, because ye go to law one with another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Why do ye not rather take wrong?

Author: Paul
Sentence: why do ye not rather [suffer yourselves to] be defrauded?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay, ye do wrong, and defraud, and that [your] brethren.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that the unrighteous shall not inherit the kingdom of God?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not deceived: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor abusers of themselves with mankind,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners, shall inherit the kingdom of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And such were some of you: but ye are washed, but ye are sanctified, but ye are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All things are lawful unto me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will not be brought under the power of any.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats: but God shall destroy both it and them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the body [is] not for fornication, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And God hath both raised up the Lord, and will also raise up us by his own power.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Christ?

Author: Paul
Sentence: shall I then take the members of Christ, and make [them] the members of an harlot?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God forbid.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What?

Author: Paul
Sentence: know ye not that he which is joined to an harlot is one body?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for two, saith he, shall be one flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Flee fornication.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Every sin that a man doeth is without the body; but he that committeth fornication sinneth against his own body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What?

Author: Paul
Sentence: know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost [which is] in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God’s.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now concerning the things whereof ye wrote unto me: [It is] good for a man not to touch a woman.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless, [to avoid] fornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and likewise also the husband hath not power of his own body, but the wife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Defraud ye not one the other, except [it be] with consent for a time, that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer; and come together again, that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I speak this by permission, [and] not of commandment.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I would that all men were even as I myself.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And unto the married I command, [yet] not I, but the Lord, Let not the wife depart from [her] husband:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to [her] husband: and let not the husband put away [his] wife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to the rest speak I, not the Lord: If any brother hath a wife that believeth not, and she be pleased to dwell with him, let him not put her away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband: else were your children unclean; but now are they holy.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such [cases]: but God hath called us to peace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save [thy] husband?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save [thy] wife?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And so ordain I in all churches.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Is any man called being circumcised?

Author: Paul
Sentence: let him not become uncircumcised.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Is any called in uncircumcision?

Author: Paul
Sentence: let him not be circumcised.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Art thou called [being] a servant?

Author: Paul
Sentence: care not for it: but if thou mayest be made free, use [it] rather.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that is called in the Lord, [being] a servant, is the Lord’s freeman: likewise also he that is called, [being] free, is Christ’s servant.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now concerning virgins I have no commandment of the Lord: yet I give my judgment, as one that hath obtained mercy of the Lord to be faithful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress, [I say], that [it is] good for a man so to be.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Art thou bound unto a wife?

Author: Paul
Sentence: seek not to be loosed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Art thou loosed from a wife?

Author: Paul
Sentence: seek not a wife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin marry, she hath not sinned.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless such shall have trouble in the flesh: but I spare you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But this I say, brethren, the time [is] short: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had none;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though they rejoiced not; and they that buy, as though they possessed not;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And they that use this world, as not abusing [it]: for the fashion of this world passeth away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I would have you without carefulness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that is unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord, how he may please the Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please [his] wife.

Author: Paul
Sentence: There is difference [also] between a wife and a virgin.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The unmarried woman careth for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit: but she that is married careth for the things of the world, how she may please [her] husband.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And this I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon the Lord without distraction.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of [her] age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in his heart, having no necessity, but hath power over his own will, and hath so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, doeth well.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then he that giveth [her] in marriage doeth well; but he that giveth [her] not in marriage doeth better.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol [is] nothing in the world, and that [there is] none other God but one.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, (as there be gods many, and lords many,)

Author: Paul
Sentence: But to us [there is but] one God, the Father, of whom [are] all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom [are] all things, and we by him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Howbeit [there is] not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat [it] as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol’s temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Am I not an apostle?

Author: Paul
Sentence: am I not free?

Author: Paul
Sentence: have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord?

Author: Paul
Sentence: are not ye my work in the Lord?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If I be not an apostle unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are ye in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Have we not power to eat and to drink?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, and [as] the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who goeth a warfare any time at his own charges?

Author: Paul
Sentence: who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or who feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Say I these things as a man?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or saith not the law the same also?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For it is written in the law of Moses, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox that treadeth out the corn.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Doth God take care for oxen?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Or saith he [it] altogether for our sakes?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For our sakes, no doubt, [this] is written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that thresheth in hope should be partaker of his hope.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If we have sown unto you spiritual things, [is it] a great thing if we shall reap your carnal things?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If others be partakers of [this] power over you, [are] not we rather?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do ye not know that they which minister about holy things live [of the things] of the temple?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and they which wait at the altar are partakers with the altar?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even so hath the Lord ordained that they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I have used none of these things: neither have I written these things, that it should be so done unto me: for [it were] better for me to die, than that any man should make my glorying void.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if I do this thing willingly, I have a reward: but if against my will, a dispensation [of the gospel] is committed unto me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What is my reward then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Verily] that, when I preach the gospel, I may make the gospel of Christ without charge, that I abuse not my power in the gospel.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I be free from all [men], yet have I made myself servant unto all, that I might gain the more.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And unto the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews; to them that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain them that are under the law;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To them that are without law, as without law, (being not without law to God, but under the law to Christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the weak became I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am made all things to all [men], that I might by all means save some.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And this I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might be partaker thereof with [you].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one receiveth the prize?

Author: Paul
Sentence: So run, that ye may obtain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And every man that striveth for the mastery is temperate in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now they [do it] to obtain a corruptible crown; but we an incorruptible.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I therefore so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one that beateth the air:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I keep under my body, and bring [it] into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover, brethren, I would not that ye should be ignorant, how that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And did all eat the same spiritual meat;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And did all drink the same spiritual drink: for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them: and that Rock was Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But with many of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the wilderness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither be ye idolaters, as [were] some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were destroyed of the destroyer.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

Author: Paul
Sentence: There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God [is] faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear [it].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak as to wise men; judge ye what I say.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ?

Author: Paul
Sentence: The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we [being] many are one bread, [and] one body: for we are all partakers of that one bread.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?

Author: Paul
Sentence: What say I then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is any thing?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But [I say], that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that ye should have fellowship with devils.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot be partakers of the Lord’s table, and of the table of devils.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy?

Author: Paul
Sentence: are we stronger than he?

Author: Paul
Sentence: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man seek his own, but every man another’s [wealth].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, [that] eat, asking no question for conscience sake:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the earth [is] the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any of them that believe not bid you [to a feast], and ye be disposed to go; whatsoever is set before you, eat, asking no question for conscience sake.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth [is] the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of another [man’s] conscience?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even as I please all [men] in all [things], not seeking mine own profit, but the [profit] of many, that they may be saved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be ye followers of me, even as I also [am] of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered [them] to you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman [is] the man; and the head of Christ [is] God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Every man praying or prophesying, having [his] head covered, dishonoureth his head.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with [her] head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For a man indeed ought not to cover [his] head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause ought the woman to have power on [her] head because of the angels.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as the woman [is] of the man, even so [is] the man also by the woman; but all things of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for [her] hair is given her for a covering.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now in this that I declare [unto you] I praise [you] not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When ye come together therefore into one place, [this] is not to eat the Lord’s supper.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in eating every one taketh before [other] his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What?

Author: Paul
Sentence: have ye not houses to eat and to drink in?

Author: Paul
