Sentence: or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: What shall I say to you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: shall I praise you in this?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I praise [you] not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the [same] night in which he was betrayed took bread:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And when he had given thanks, he brake [it], and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: After the same manner also [he took] the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink [it], in remembrance of me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord’s death till he come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink [this] cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of [that] bread, and drink of [that] cup.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this cause many [are] weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the rest will I set in order when I come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now concerning spiritual [gifts], brethren, I would not have you ignorant.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye know that ye were Gentiles, carried away unto these dumb idols, even as ye were led.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I give you to understand, that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calleth Jesus accursed: and [that] no man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the Holy Ghost.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which worketh all in all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another [divers] kinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also [is] Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether [we be] Jews or Gentiles, whether [we be] bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the body is not one member, but many.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If the whole body [were] an eye, where [were] the hearing?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If the whole [were] hearing, where [were] the smelling?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if they were all one member, where [were] the body?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now [are they] many members, yet but one body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And those [members] of the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomely [parts] have more abundant comeliness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For our comely [parts] have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that [part] which lacked:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That there should be no schism in the body; but [that] the members should have the same care one for another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Are] all apostles?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [are] all prophets?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [are] all teachers?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [are] all workers of miracles?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Have all the gifts of healing?

Author: Paul
Sentence: do all speak with tongues?

Author: Paul
Sentence: do all interpret?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become [as] sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And though I have [the gift of] prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And though I bestow all my goods to feed [the poor], and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Charity suffereth long, [and] is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

Author: Paul
Sentence: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Charity never faileth: but whether [there be] prophecies, they shall fail; whether [there be] tongues, they shall cease; whether [there be] knowledge, it shall vanish away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these [is] charity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Follow after charity, and desire spiritual [gifts], but rather that ye may prophesy.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth [him]; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men [to] edification, and exhortation, and comfort.

Author: Paul
Sentence: He that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I would that ye all spake with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied: for greater [is] he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

Author: Paul
Sentence: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for ye shall speak into the air.

Author: Paul
Sentence: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of them [is] without signification.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh [shall be] a barbarian unto me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual [gifts], seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore let him that speaketh in an [unknown] tongue pray that he may interpret.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if I pray in an [unknown] tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What is it then?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that [by my voice] I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an [unknown] tongue.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the law it is written, With [men of] other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to them that believe not: but prophesying [serveth] not for them that believe not, but for them which believe.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in [those that are] unlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, or [one] unlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so falling down on [his] face he will worship God, and report that God is in you of a truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: How is it then, brethren?

Author: Paul
Sentence: when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let all things be done unto edifying.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man speak in an [unknown] tongue, [let it be] by two, or at the most [by] three, and [that] by course; and let one interpret.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the other judge.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If [any thing] be revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God is not [the author] of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but [they are commanded] to be under obedience, as also saith the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.

Author: Paul
Sentence: What?

Author: Paul
Sentence: came the word of God out from you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or came it unto you only?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let all things be done decently and in order.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

Author: Paul
Sentence: By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:

Author: Paul
Sentence: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.

Author: Paul
Sentence: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which [was bestowed] upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore whether [it were] I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if Christ be not risen, then [is] our preaching vain, and your faith [is] also vain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if Christ be not raised, your faith [is] vain; ye are yet in your sins.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But now is Christ risen from the dead, [and] become the firstfruits of them that slept.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For since by man [came] death, by man [came] also the resurrection of the dead.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ’s at his coming.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Then [cometh] the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The last enemy [that] shall be destroyed [is] death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he hath put all things under his feet.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But when he saith, all things are put under [him, it is] manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all?

Author: Paul
Sentence: why are they then baptized for the dead?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak [this] to your shame.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But some [man] will say, How are the dead raised up?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and with what body do they come?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Thou] fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other [grain]:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All flesh [is] not the same flesh: but [there is] one [kind of] flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, [and] another of birds.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [There are] also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial [is] one, and the [glory] of the terrestrial [is] another.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [There is] one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for [one] star differeth from [another] star in glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So also [is] the resurrection of the dead.

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam [was made] a quickening spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Howbeit that [was] not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The first man [is] of the earth, earthy: the second man [is] the Lord from heaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As [is] the earthy, such [are] they also that are earthy: and as [is] the heavenly, such [are] they also that are heavenly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

Author: Paul
Sentence: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal [must] put on immortality.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: O death, where [is] thy sting?

Author: Paul
Sentence: O grave, where [is] thy victory?

Author: Paul
Sentence: The sting of death [is] sin; and the strength of sin [is] the law.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But thanks [be] to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Upon the first [day] of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as [God] hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by [your] letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and [there are] many adversaries.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also [do].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

Author: Paul
Sentence: As touching [our] brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let all your things be done with charity.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and [that] they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

Author: Paul
Sentence: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with [us], and laboureth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The churches of Asia salute you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

Author: Paul
Sentence: All the brethren greet you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The salutation of [me] Paul with mine own hand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: My love [be] with you all in Christ Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy [our] brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Grace [be] to you and peace from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Blessed [be] God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And whether we be afflicted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, [it is] for your consolation and salvation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And our hope of you [is] stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so [shall ye be] also of the consolation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver [us];

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift [bestowed] upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;

Author: Paul
Sentence: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also [are] ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.

Author: Paul
Sentence: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?

Author: Paul
Sentence: But [as] God [is] true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, [even] by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For all the promises of God in him [are] yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, [is] God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I wrote this same unto you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice; having confidence in you all, that my joy is [the joy] of you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you with many tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if any have caused grief, he hath not grieved me, but in part: that I may not overcharge you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Sufficient to such a man [is] this punishment, which [was inflicted] of many.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So that contrariwise ye [ought] rather to forgive [him], and comfort [him], lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirm [your] love toward him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: To whom ye forgive any thing, I [forgive] also: for if I forgave any thing, to whom I forgave [it], for your sakes [forgave I it] in the person of Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to [preach] Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened unto me of the Lord,

Author: Paul
Sentence: I had no rest in my spirit, because I found not Titus my brother: but taking my leave of them, I went from thence into Macedonia.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now thanks [be] unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ, and maketh manifest the savour of his knowledge by us in every place.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are unto God a sweet savour of Christ, in them that are saved, and in them that perish:

Author: Paul
Sentence: To the one [we are] the savour of death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And who [is] sufficient for these things?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we are not as many, which corrupt the word of God: but as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God speak we in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do we begin again to commend ourselves?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or need we, as some [others], epistles of commendation to you, or [letters] of commendation from you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

Author: Paul
Sentence: [Forasmuch as ye are] manifestly declared to be the epistle of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tables of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think any thing as of ourselves; but our sufficiency [is] of God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who also hath made us able ministers of the new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the letter killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if the ministration of death, written [and] engraven in stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not stedfastly behold the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance; which [glory] was to be done away:

Author: Paul
Sentence: How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if the ministration of condemnation [be] glory, much more doth the ministration of righteousness exceed in glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if that which is done away [was] glorious, much more that which remaineth [is] glorious.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not as Moses, [which] put a vail over his face, that the children of Israel could not stedfastly look to the end of that which is abolished:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which [vail] is done away in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now the Lord is that Spirit: and where the Spirit of the Lord [is], there [is] liberty.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we all, with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord, are changed into the same image from glory to glory, [even] as by the Spirit of the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

Author: Paul
Sentence: But have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost:

Author: Paul
Sentence: In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus’ sake.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, hath shined in our hearts, to [give] the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.

Author: Paul
Sentence: [We are] troubled on every side, yet not distressed; [we are] perplexed, but not in despair;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Always bearing about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our body.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus’ sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We having the same spirit of faith, according as it is written, I believed, and therefore have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore speak;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present [us] with you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For all things [are] for your sakes, that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward [man] is renewed day by day.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding [and] eternal weight of glory;

Author: Paul
Sentence: While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen [are] temporal; but the things which are not seen [are] eternal.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we know that if our earthly house of [this] tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven:

Author: Paul
Sentence: If so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we that are in [this] tabernacle do groan, being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed, but clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thing [is] God, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore [we are] always confident, knowing that, whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For we walk by faith, not by sight:)

Author: Paul
Sentence: We are confident, [I say], and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be accepted of him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things [done] in [his] body, according to that he hath done, whether [it be] good or bad.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord, we persuade men; but we are made manifest unto God; and I trust also are made manifest in your consciences.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to [answer] them which glory in appearance, and not in heart.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For whether we be beside ourselves, [it is] to God: or whether we be sober, [it is] for your cause.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And [that] he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we [him] no more.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore if any man [be] in Christ, [he is] a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And all things [are] of God, who hath reconciled us to himself by Jesus Christ, and hath given to us the ministry of reconciliation;

Author: Paul
Sentence: To wit, that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now then we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God did beseech [you] by us: we pray [you] in Christ’s stead, be ye reconciled to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For he hath made him [to be] sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: We then, [as] workers together [with him], beseech [you] also that ye receive not the grace of God in vain.

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the day of salvation have I succoured thee: behold, now [is] the accepted time; behold, now [is] the day of salvation.)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But in all [things] approving ourselves as the ministers of God, in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses,

Author: Paul
Sentence: In stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings;

Author: Paul
Sentence: By pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the Holy Ghost, by love unfeigned,

Author: Paul
Sentence: By the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

Author: Paul
Sentence: By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as deceivers, and [yet] true;

Author: Paul
Sentence: As unknown, and [yet] well known; as dying, and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed;

Author: Paul
Sentence: As sorrowful, yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and [yet] possessing all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: O [ye] Corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now for a recompence in the same, (I speak as unto [my] children,) be ye also enlarged.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship hath righteousness with unrighteousness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: and what communion hath light with darkness?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And what concord hath Christ with Belial?

Author: Paul
Sentence: or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?

Author: Paul
Sentence: And what agreement hath the temple of God with idols?

Author: Paul
Sentence: for ye are the temple of the living God; as God hath said, I will dwell in them, and walk in [them]; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the Lord, and touch not the unclean [thing]; and I will receive you,

Author: Paul
Sentence: And will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, saith the Lord Almighty.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Having therefore these promises, dearly beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Receive us; we have wronged no man, we have corrupted no man, we have defrauded no man.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak not [this] to condemn [you]: for I have said before, that ye are in our hearts to die and live with [you].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Great [is] my boldness of speech toward you, great [is] my glorying of you: I am filled with comfort, I am exceeding joyful in all our tribulation.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For, when we were come into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but we were troubled on every side; without [were] fightings, within [were] fears.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Nevertheless God, that comforteth those that are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not by his coming only, but by the consolation wherewith he was comforted in you, when he told us your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so that I rejoiced the more.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I made you sorry with a letter, I do not repent, though I did repent: for I perceive that the same epistle hath made you sorry, though [it were] but for a season.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea, [what] clearing of yourselves, yea, [what] indignation, yea, [what] fear, yea, [what] vehement desire, yea, [what] zeal, yea, [what] revenge!

Author: Paul
Sentence: In all [things] ye have approved yourselves to be clear in this matter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore, though I wrote unto you, [I did it] not for his cause that had done the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might appear unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore we were comforted in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly the more joyed we for the joy of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if I have boasted any thing to him of you, I am not ashamed; but as we spake all things to you in truth, even so our boasting, which [I made] before Titus, is found a truth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all [things].

Author: Paul
Sentence: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

Author: Paul
Sentence: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For to [their] power, I bear record, yea, and beyond [their] power [they were] willing of themselves;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and [take upon us] the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And [this they did], not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore, as ye abound in every [thing, in] faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and [in] all diligence, and [in] your love to us, [see] that ye abound in this grace also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And herein I give [my] advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now therefore perform the doing [of it]; that as [there was] a readiness to will, so [there may be] a performance also out of that which ye have.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if there be first a willing mind, [it is] accepted according to that a man hath, [and] not according to that he hath not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [I mean] not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But by an equality, [that] now at this time your abundance [may be a supply] for their want, that their abundance also may be [a supply] for your want: that there may be equality:

Author: Paul
Sentence: As it is written, He that [had gathered] much had nothing over; and he that [had gathered] little had no lack.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But thanks [be] to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise [is] in the gospel throughout all the churches;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And not [that] only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and [declaration of] your ready mind:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which [I have] in you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whether [any do inquire] of Titus, [he is] my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren [be inquired of, they are] the messengers of the churches, [and] the glory of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For as touching the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you:

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I know the forwardness of your mind, for which I boast of you to them of Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal hath provoked very many.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Lest haply if they of Macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we (that we say not, ye) should be ashamed in this same confident boasting.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brethren, that they would go before unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof ye had notice before, that the same might be ready, as [a matter of] bounty, and not as [of] covetousness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But this [I say], He which soweth sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he which soweth bountifully shall reap also bountifully.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Every man according as he purposeth in his heart, [so let him give]; not grudgingly, or of necessity: for God loveth a cheerful giver.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And God [is] able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all [things], may abound to every good work:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (As it is written, He hath dispersed abroad; he hath given to the poor: his righteousness remaineth for ever.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minister bread for [your] food, and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For the administration of this service not only supplieth the want of the saints, but is abundant also by many thanksgivings unto God;

Author: Paul
Sentence: Whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for [your] liberal distribution unto them, and unto all [men];

Author: Paul
Sentence: And by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thanks [be] unto God for his unspeakable gift.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence [am] base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I beseech [you], that I may not be bold when I am present with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

Author: Paul
Sentence: (For the weapons of our warfare [are] not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: Casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;

Author: Paul
Sentence: And having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Do ye look on things after the outward appearance?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If any man trust to himself that he is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he [is] Christ’s, even so [are] we Christ’s.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:

Author: Paul
Sentence: That I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For [his] letters, say they, [are] weighty and powerful; but [his] bodily presence [is] weak, and [his] speech contemptible.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such [will we be] also in deed when we are present.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But we will not boast of things without [our] measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For we stretch not ourselves beyond [our measure], as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in [preaching] the gospel of Christ:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Not boasting of things without [our] measure, [that is], of other men’s labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,

Author: Paul
Sentence: To preach the gospel in the [regions] beyond you, [and] not to boast in another man’s line of things made ready to our hand.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Would to God ye could bear with me a little in [my] folly: and indeed bear with me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present [you as] a chaste virgin to Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or [if] ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with [him].

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But though [I be] rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I robbed other churches, taking wages [of them], to do you service.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all [things] I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and [so] will I keep [myself].

Author: Paul
Sentence: As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Wherefore?

Author: Paul
Sentence: because I love you not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: God knoweth.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For such [are] false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore [it is] no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

Author: Paul
Sentence: That which I speak, I speak [it] not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye [yourselves] are wise.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour [you], if a man take [of you], if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Are they Hebrews?

Author: Paul
Sentence: so [am] I.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Are they Israelites?

Author: Paul
Sentence: so [am] I.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Are they the seed of Abraham?

Author: Paul
Sentence: so [am] I.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Are they ministers of Christ?

Author: Paul
Sentence: (I speak as a fool) I [am] more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of the Jews five times received I forty [stripes] save one.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

Author: Paul
Sentence: [In] journeyings often, [in] perils of waters, [in] perils of robbers, [in] perils by [mine own] countrymen, [in] perils by the heathen, [in] perils in the city, [in] perils in the wilderness, [in] perils in the sea, [in] perils among false brethren;

Author: Paul
Sentence: In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Who is weak, and I am not weak?

Author: Paul
Sentence: who is offended, and I burn not?

Author: Paul
Sentence: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

Author: Paul
Sentence: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:

Author: Paul
Sentence: And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.

Author: Paul
Sentence: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)

Author: Paul
Sentence: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but [now] I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me [to be], or [that] he heareth of me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except [it be] that I myself was not burdensome to you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: forgive me this wrong.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.

Author: Paul
Sentence: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.

Author: Paul
Sentence: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: I desired Titus, and with [him] I sent a brother.

Author: Paul
Sentence: Did Titus make a gain of you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: walked we not in the same spirit?

Author: Paul
Sentence: [walked we] not in the same steps?

Author: Paul
Sentence: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you?

Author: Paul
Sentence: we speak before God in Christ: but [we do] all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.

Author: Paul
Sentence: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and [that] I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest [there be] debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:

Author: Paul
Sentence: [And] lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and [that] I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.

Author: Paul
Sentence: This [is] the third [time] I am coming to you.

Author: Paul
Sentence: In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.

Author: Paul
Sentence: I told you before, and foretell you, as if I were present, the second time; and being absent now I write to them which heretofore have sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not spare:

Author: Paul
Sentence: Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, which to you-ward is not weak, but is mighty in you.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

Author: Peter
Sentence: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

Author: Peter
Sentence: To an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:

Author: Peter
Sentence: That the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see [him] not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Receiving the end of your faith, [even] the salvation of [your] souls.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace [that should come] unto you:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

Author: Peter
Sentence: As obedient children, not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:

Author: Peter
Sentence: But as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Because it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And if ye call on the Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to every man’s work, pass the time of your sojourning [here] in fear:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, [as] silver and gold, from your vain conversation [received] by tradition from your fathers;

Author: Peter
Sentence: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who verily was foreordained before the foundation of the world, but was manifest in these last times for you,

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Seeing ye have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit unto unfeigned love of the brethren, [see that ye] love one another with a pure heart fervently:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For all flesh [is] as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass.

Author: Peter
Sentence: The grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:

Author: Peter
Sentence: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And this is the word which by the gospel is preached unto you.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,

Author: Peter
Sentence: As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:

Author: Peter
Sentence: If so be ye have tasted that the Lord [is] gracious.

Author: Peter
Sentence: To whom coming, [as unto] a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, [and] precious,

Author: Peter
Sentence: Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Unto you therefore which believe [he is] precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

Author: Peter
Sentence: And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, [even to them] which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But ye [are] a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Which in time past [were] not a people, but [are] now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Dearly beloved, I beseech [you] as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by [your] good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Author: Peter
Sentence: As free, and not using [your] liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Honour all [men].

Author: Peter
Sentence: Love the brotherhood.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Fear God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Honour the king.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Servants, [be] subject to [your] masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For this [is] thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For what glory [is it], if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently?

Author: Peter
Sentence: but if, when ye do well, and suffer [for it], ye take it patiently, this [is] acceptable with God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed [himself] to him that judgeth righteously:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Likewise, ye wives, [be] in subjection to your own husbands; that, if any obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the conversation of the wives;

Author: Peter
Sentence: While they behold your chaste conversation [coupled] with fear.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whose adorning let it not be that outward [adorning] of plaiting the hair, and of wearing of gold, or of putting on of apparel;

Author: Peter
Sentence: But [let it be] the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible, [even the ornament] of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Even as Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any amazement.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Likewise, ye husbands, dwell with [them] according to knowledge, giving honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being heirs together of the grace of life; that your prayers be not hindered.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Finally, [be ye] all of one mind, having compassion one of another, love as brethren, [be] pitiful, [be] courteous:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Let him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensue it.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For the eyes of the Lord [are] over the righteous, and his ears [are open] unto their prayers: but the face of the Lord [is] against them that do evil.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And who [is] he that will harm you, if ye be followers of that which is good?

Author: Peter
Sentence: But and if ye suffer for righteousness’ sake, happy [are ye]: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;

Author: Peter
Sentence: But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and [be] ready always to [give] an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Having a good conscience; that, whereas they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For [it is] better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well doing, than for evil doing.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For Christ also hath once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, that he might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the Spirit:

Author: Peter
Sentence: By which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Which sometime were disobedient, when once the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls were saved by water.

Author: Peter
Sentence: The like figure whereunto [even] baptism doth also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God,) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Forasmuch then as Christ hath suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;

Author: Peter
Sentence: That he no longer should live the rest of [his] time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For the time past of [our] life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, when we walked in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with [them] to the same excess of riot, speaking evil of [you]:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead, that they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Use hospitality one to another without grudging.

Author: Peter
Sentence: As every man hath received the gift, [even so] minister the same one to another, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Author: Peter
Sentence: If any man speak, [let him speak] as the oracles of God; if any man minister, [let him do it] as of the ability which God giveth: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try you, as though some strange thing happened unto you:

Author: Peter
Sentence: But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ’s sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

Author: Peter
Sentence: If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy [are ye]; for the spirit of glory and of God resteth upon you: on their part he is evil spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But let none of you suffer as a murderer, or [as] a thief, or [as] an evildoer, or as a busybody in other men’s matters.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Yet if [any man suffer] as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For the time [is come] that judgment must begin at the house of God: and if [it] first [begin] at us, what shall the end [be] of them that obey not the gospel of God?

Author: Peter
Sentence: And if the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore let them that suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls [to him] in well doing, as unto a faithful Creator.

Author: Peter
Sentence: The elders which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking the oversight [thereof], not by constraint, but willingly; not for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Neither as being lords over [God’s] heritage, but being ensamples to the flock.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And when the chief Shepherd shall appear, ye shall receive a crown of glory that fadeth not away.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Yea, all [of you] be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whom resist stedfast in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren that are in the world.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle [you].

Author: Peter
Sentence: To him [be] glory and dominion for ever and ever.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Peter
Sentence: By Silvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I suppose, I have written briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand.

Author: Peter
Sentence: The [church that is] at Babylon, elected together with [you], saluteth you; and [so doth] Marcus my son.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Peace [be] with you all that are in Christ Jesus.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Amen.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

Author: Peter
Sentence: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that [pertain] unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make [you that ye shall] neither [be] barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

Author: Peter
