Sentence: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:

Author: Peter
Sentence: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know [them], and be established in the present truth.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting [you] in remembrance;

Author: Peter
Sentence: Knowing that shortly I must put off [this] my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.

Author: Peter
Sentence: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

Author: Peter
Sentence: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

Author: Peter
Sentence: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake [as they were] moved by the Holy Ghost.

Author: Peter
Sentence: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

Author: Peter
Sentence: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.

Author: Peter
Sentence: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast [them] down to hell, and delivered [them] into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth [person], a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned [them] with an overthrow, making [them] an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;

Author: Peter
Sentence: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:

Author: Peter
Sentence: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed [his] righteous soul from day to day with [their] unlawful deeds;)

Author: James
Sentence: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad, greeting.

Author: James
Sentence: My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers temptations;

Author: James
Sentence: Knowing [this], that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

Author: James
Sentence: But let patience have [her] perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

Author: James
Sentence: If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all [men] liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

Author: James
Sentence: But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering.

Author: James
Sentence: For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

Author: James
Sentence: For let not that man think that he shall receive any thing of the Lord.

Author: James
Sentence: A double minded man [is] unstable in all his ways.

Author: James
Sentence: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted:

Author: James
Sentence: But the rich, in that he is made low: because as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.

Author: James
Sentence: For the sun is no sooner risen with a burning heat, but it withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of the fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in his ways.

Author: James
Sentence: Blessed [is] the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.

Author: James
Sentence: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man:

Author: James
Sentence: But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.

Author: James
Sentence: Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

Author: James
Sentence: Do not err, my beloved brethren.

Author: James
Sentence: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and cometh down from the Father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither shadow of turning.

Author: James
Sentence: Of his own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

Author: James
Sentence: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath:

Author: James
Sentence: For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God.

Author: James
Sentence: Wherefore lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness, and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.

Author: James
Sentence: But be ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving your own selves.

Author: James
Sentence: For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:

Author: James
Sentence: For he beholdeth himself, and goeth his way, and straightway forgetteth what manner of man he was.

Author: James
Sentence: But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth [therein], he being not a forgetful hearer, but a doer of the work, this man shall be blessed in his deed.

Author: James
Sentence: If any man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceiveth his own heart, this man’s religion [is] vain.

Author: James
Sentence: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, [and] to keep himself unspotted from the world.

Author: James
Sentence: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, [the Lord] of glory, with respect of persons.

Author: James
Sentence: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;

Author: James
Sentence: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:

Author: James
Sentence: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?

Author: James
Sentence: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?

Author: James
Sentence: But ye have despised the poor.

Author: James
Sentence: Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?

Author: James
Sentence: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?

Author: James
Sentence: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:

Author: James
Sentence: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.

Author: James
Sentence: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one [point], he is guilty of all.

Author: James
Sentence: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill.

Author: James
Sentence: Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.

Author: James
Sentence: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.

Author: James
Sentence: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.

Author: James
Sentence: What [doth it] profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works?

Author: James
Sentence: can faith save him?

Author: James
Sentence: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

Author: James
Sentence: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be [ye] warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what [doth it] profit?

Author: James
Sentence: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.

Author: James
Sentence: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.

Author: James
Sentence: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.

Author: James
Sentence: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?

Author: James
Sentence: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?

Author: James
Sentence: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?

Author: James
Sentence: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.

Author: James
Sentence: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.

Author: James
Sentence: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent [them] out another way?

Author: James
Sentence: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.

Author: James
Sentence: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

Author: James
Sentence: For in many things we offend all.

Author: James
Sentence: If any man offend not in word, the same [is] a perfect man, [and] able also to bridle the whole body.

Author: James
Sentence: Behold, we put bits in the horses’ mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

Author: James
Sentence: Behold also the ships, which though [they be] so great, and [are] driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

Author: James
Sentence: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things.

Author: James
Sentence: Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

Author: James
Sentence: And the tongue [is] a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

Author: James
Sentence: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

Author: James
Sentence: But the tongue can no man tame; [it is] an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

Author: James
Sentence: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

Author: James
Sentence: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing.

Author: James
Sentence: My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

Author: James
Sentence: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet [water] and bitter?

Author: James
Sentence: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries?

Author: James
Sentence: either a vine, figs?

Author: James
Sentence: so [can] no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

Author: James
Sentence: Who [is] a wise man and endued with knowledge among you?

Author: James
Sentence: let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

Author: James
Sentence: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

Author: James
Sentence: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but [is] earthly, sensual, devilish.

Author: James
Sentence: For where envying and strife [is], there [is] confusion and every evil work.

Author: James
Sentence: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, [and] easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

Author: James
Sentence: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

Author: James
Sentence: From whence [come] wars and fightings among you?

Author: James
Sentence: [come they] not hence, [even] of your lusts that war in your members?

Author: James
Sentence: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

Author: James
Sentence: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume [it] upon your lusts.

Author: James
Sentence: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God?

Author: James
Sentence: whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

Author: James
Sentence: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?

Author: James
Sentence: But he giveth more grace.

Author: James
Sentence: Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

Author: James
Sentence: Submit yourselves therefore to God.

Author: James
Sentence: Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

Author: James
Sentence: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you.

Author: James
Sentence: Cleanse [your] hands, [ye] sinners; and purify [your] hearts, [ye] double minded.

Author: James
Sentence: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness.

Author: James
Sentence: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

Author: James
Sentence: Speak not evil one of another, brethren.

Author: James
Sentence: He that speaketh evil of [his] brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

Author: James
Sentence: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

Author: James
Sentence: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:

Author: James
Sentence: Whereas ye know not what [shall be] on the morrow.

Author: James
Sentence: For what [is] your life?

Author: James
Sentence: It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.

Author: James
Sentence: For that ye [ought] to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

Author: James
Sentence: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

Author: James
Sentence: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth [it] not, to him it is sin.

Author: James
Sentence: Go to now, [ye] rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon [you].

Author: Jude
Sentence: Jude, the servant of Jesus Christ, and brother of James, to them that are sanctified by God the Father, and preserved in Jesus Christ, [and] called:

Author: Jude
Sentence: Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.

Author: Jude
Sentence: Beloved, when I gave all diligence to write unto you of the common salvation, it was needful for me to write unto you, and exhort [you] that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints.

Author: Jude
Sentence: For there are certain men crept in unawares, who were before of old ordained to this condemnation, ungodly men, turning the grace of our God into lasciviousness, and denying the only Lord God, and our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Jude
Sentence: I will therefore put you in remembrance, though ye once knew this, how that the Lord, having saved the people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed them that believed not.

Author: Jude
Sentence: And the angels which kept not their first estate, but left their own habitation, he hath reserved in everlasting chains under darkness unto the judgment of the great day.

Author: Jude
Sentence: Even as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities about them in like manner, giving themselves over to fornication, and going after strange flesh, are set forth for an example, suffering the vengeance of eternal fire.

Author: Jude
Sentence: Likewise also these [filthy] dreamers defile the flesh, despise dominion, and speak evil of dignities.

Author: Jude
Sentence: Yet Michael the archangel, when contending with the devil he disputed about the body of Moses, durst not bring against him a railing accusation, but said, The Lord rebuke thee.

Author: Jude
Sentence: But these speak evil of those things which they know not: but what they know naturally, as brute beasts, in those things they corrupt themselves.

Author: Jude
Sentence: Woe unto them!

Author: Jude
Sentence: for they have gone in the way of Cain, and ran greedily after the error of Balaam for reward, and perished in the gainsaying of Core.

Author: Jude
Sentence: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds [they are] without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

Author: Jude
Sentence: Raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own shame; wandering stars, to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever.

Author: Jude
Sentence: And Enoch also, the seventh from Adam, prophesied of these, saying, Behold, the Lord cometh with ten thousands of his saints,

Author: Jude
Sentence: To execute judgment upon all, and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed, and of all their hard [speeches] which ungodly sinners have spoken against him.

Author: Jude
Sentence: These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaketh great swelling [words], having men’s persons in admiration because of advantage.

Author: Jude
Sentence: But, beloved, remember ye the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ;

Author: Jude
Sentence: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time, who should walk after their own ungodly lusts.

Author: Jude
Sentence: These be they who separate themselves, sensual, having not the Spirit.

Author: Jude
Sentence: But ye, beloved, building up yourselves on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Ghost,
